title: (Untitled)
description: WhatsApp plans to roll out a new feature called Private Processing,  designed to preserve WhatsApp’s security and privacy guarantees while offering users access to AI message summarization and composition tools. Some users worry about the security implications, given that interactions with the AI assistant aren't shielded from Meta the way end-to-end encrypted chats are on the app

title: (Untitled)
description: Google makes Audio Overviews, an AI tool that enables users to turn research into podcast-like conversations in NotebookLM, available in more than 50 languages

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook disables Leicester Gazette, a local UK news publisher, for unspecified breaches of community standards, with no mechanism through which to dispute it

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta rolls out a standalone app for its Meta AI tools, similar to ChatGPT and other AI assistant apps

title: (Untitled)
description: New York Magazine joins Substack and will be sending out several of its newsletters via the platform as well as to its regular email list

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI announces rollout of shopping buttons for AI-powered search queries

title: (Untitled)
description: Publishers roll out YouTube versions of their podcasts as the platform dominates the medium

title: (Untitled)
description: Spotify pays podcast publishers and creators more than $100 million since the beginning of 2025 as a result of a new program intended to draw more creators (and their audiences) to the platform

title: (Untitled)
description: A survey from the Pew Research Center finds that about half of U.S. adults say that AI will have a very (24%) or somewhat (26%) negative impact on the news people get in the U.S. over the next 20 years

title: (Untitled)
description: Nieman Lab reports on "Tomorrow's Publisher," an AI-assisted, human-edited site about the future of news. The site has been accused of repurposing other publishers' original reporting for its content without direct compensation or licensing

title: (Untitled)
description: A popular Australian radio station is found to have been using an AI-generated DJ named "Thy", modeled after the voice of an actual employee, to host a hip-hop segment without disclosure for months

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook announces that it will begin to lower the reach of accounts sharing spammy content and make them ineligible for monetization

title: (Untitled)
description: Ziff Davis, one of the largest publishers in the U.S., sues OpenAI for “intentionally and relentlessly" reproducing exact copies and creating derivatives of its brands' works, infringing on the publisher’s copyrights and diluting its trademarks

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta lays off more than 100 people across its Reality Labs division, which creates virtual reality and wearable devices

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube tests AI Overviews in its search results, which use AI to highlight the most relevant clips from videos tied to a user's search query

title: (Untitled)
description: The European Commission fines Apple and Meta €500 million and €200 million, respectively, under the European Union's Digital Markets Act for failing to comply with its antitrust rules. Both companies are given 60 days to comply with the ruling, or else risk additional fines

title: (Untitled)
description: The New York Times reports that three users who disagreed with Elon Musk on X in late December saw their reach on the platform drastically decline afterward

title: (Untitled)
description: A Perplexity executive testified during the Google antitrust trial that Google's contract with Motorola blocked the smartphone maker from setting Perplexity AI as the default assistant on its new devices

title: (Untitled)
description: Threads opens to almost all advertisers globally, spanning 30 markets

title: (Untitled)
description: Google announces it will not roll out new standalone prompts for third-party cookies in Chrome, reversing a previously announced deprecation of third-party cookies

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram rolls out a video editing app called Edits, intended to rival TikTok's CapCut

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI, Perplexity and Yahoo express interest in buying the Chrome browser, should Google be forced by the government to sell it

title: (Untitled)
description: The Washington Post partners with OpenAI, allowing ChatGPT to display "summaries, quotes, and links to original reporting from The Post in response to relevant questions"

title: (Untitled)
description: A survey of 4,260 scientists working on artificial intelligence finds that  the most common concern, shared by nearly 80% of respondents, is that the technology "will make it difficult to tell whether news or information are fake"

title: (Untitled)
description: A study of 6,500 legislators on Facebook and Twitter finds that Republican legislators who posted low-credibility information were more likely to receive greater online attention, a pattern not observed among Democrats

title: (Untitled)
description: Ahead of the federal election in Canada, where news is blocked on Meta's feeds, hyperpartisan and misleading content from popular right-wing pages thrives

title: (Untitled)
description: Bluesky rolls out blue check verification, intended to verify notable accounts that are legitimate. In its earliest phase, the platform will work with a select few “Trusted Verifiers,” independent organizations such as news organizations that can verify accounts as members of their team

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI's internal tests find that its recently launched o3 and o4-mini models "hallucinate" more often than the company's previous reasoning models

title: (Untitled)
description: Discord starts requiring some users in the U.K. and Australia to scan their face or ID to confirm their age before accessing sensitive content on the platform. On the same day, New Jersey sues the platform for allegedly failing to adequately protect underage users from predators

title: (Untitled)
description: A federal judge rules that Google acted illegally to maintain a monopoly in some online advertising technology. The judge found that the tech giant had illegally built a monopoly over the tools used by online publishers, like news sites, as well as the software that facilitates transactions

title: (Untitled)
description: Semafor's White House correspondent reports that the Trump administration is planning to "just delay" the TikTok deal with China "until this thing works out"

title: (Untitled)
description: An analysis by SEO company Ahrefs finds that Google’s AI Overviews reduce click-through rates to top-ranked websites by more than 34 percent

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram rolls out a new feature called Blend that allows users to create a custom, personalized Reels feed for themselves and their friends

title: (Untitled)
description: Tow Center: The FTC Is Suing Meta. Will Trump Bail the Company Out?

title: (Untitled)
description: Grok adds a "memory" feature that enables the bot to recall details from past conversations with a user

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI is reportedly working on an X-like social network

title: (Untitled)
description: 4chan goes down following an apparent hack of its backend. Hackers claim to have exposed code for the site, the emails of moderators, and a list of mod communications. The site comes back online nearly two weeks later, but posting and images are still down

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok launches its own version of Community Notes, called "Footnotes"

title: (Untitled)
description: X's Grok adds a canvas-like feature for editing and creating documents and basic apps

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta announce that it is going to train its AI models on public content, such as posts and comments on Facebook and Instagram, in the EU after previously pausing its plans to do so in response to regulatory pressure due to data privacy concerns. The company says that users will have the ability to opt out of their data being used

title: (Untitled)
description: The Wrap reports that the Los Angeles Times has "moved on" from the AI-generated "bias meter" that its owner, Patrick Soon-Shiong, had wanted to establish. The paper is still using the "Insights" feature, which functions somewhat like an AI-generated version of Community Notes

title: (Untitled)
description: At a time when publishers are struggling to drive audiences to their sites, WhatsApp emerges as an unlikely source of organic referral traffic

title: (Untitled)
description: People Magazine launches a TikTok-like app intended to offer its audience a completely different experience from its website and social media accounts

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube launches a new feature that will allow users to use AI prompts to generate custom instrumental backing music that can be added to their videos

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI rolls out a new memory feature in ChatGPT that tailors answers based on users' previous conversations with the chatbot. About a week later, the company upgrades the feature to allow the chatbot to draw on memories to inform queries when searching the web

title: (Untitled)
description: Google rolls out links to its own search results in AI overviews

title: (Untitled)
description: Newsletter writers who have left Substack say that they are receiving a higher share of subscription revenue on rival services such as Ghost and Beehiiv

title: (Untitled)
description: As platform leaders are turning to community-driven correction labels because they perceive them to be more neutral, a working paper finds that Republicans are flagged more than Democrats for sharing misinformation on X's community notes

title: (Untitled)
description: Reddit integrates Google's Gemini into its conversational AI search tool, Reddit Answers

title: (Untitled)
description: Major YouTube creators sign on to a pilot program intended to give high-profile figures more control over their likenesses on the platform by surfacing AI-generated content featuring a famous person’s likeness, allowing them to request removal. The pilot comes as YouTube expresses its support for the NO FAKES Act, legislation that would establish rules around the use of AI copies of people's faces, names and voices

title: (Untitled)
description: Google rolls out the ability to turn Google Docs into podcasts

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta fails to stop dangerous disinformation in languages like Swahili, Amharic, and Oromo, according to fact-checkers and internal documents

title: (Untitled)
description: WordPress.com launches a free AI website builder that allows users to create a functioning website using an AI chat-style interface

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI files a countersuit against Elon Musk, saying on X that “Elon’s nonstop actions against us are just bad-faith tactics to slow down OpenAI and seize control of the leading AI innovations for his personal benefit"

title: (Untitled)
description: European Press Publishers’ Associations ENPA, EMMA, EPC and NME write a joint letter urging the European Commission to take immediate measures against Google’s “Site Reputation Abuse" policy, which they say "penalises websites in the ranking of Google Search for cooperating with third-party content providers, regardless of the website’s editorial oversight over such content or its respective quality"

title: (Untitled)
description: The Trump administration invites John Stoll, who was recently appointed head of news at X, to claim the "new media seat" at a White House press briefing

title: (Untitled)
description: A survey by Poynter and the University of Minnesota finds that audiences are skeptical about AI in journalism, with about 50% saying they have no interest in using an AI chatbot to get information from news organizations

title: (Untitled)
description: After years of declining referral traffic on Facebook, some publishers are seeing a new wave of growth on the platform. According to Similarweb data, more than a third of major global news websites saw both Facebook share and total social referral traffic growth in March 2025, compared to one year earlier

title: (Untitled)
description: Quartz becomes the latest media brand to see low-quality AI use precede mass layoffs, Futurism reports

title: (Untitled)
description: A Press Gazette investigation finds that the advent of generative AI tools appears to have fueled "a rise in expert commentators who have appeared widely in national newspapers but who are either not real, not what they seem to be or at the very least have CVs which do not justify their wide exposure in major newsbrands." After the story comes out, publishers like News UK, Reach and Yahoo News delete and amend stories featuring fake "experts"

title: (Untitled)
description: Google adds multimodal capabilities to its AI Mode chatbot, which combines a custom version of Gemini AI with the company's Lens image recognition technology to allow users to ask complex questions about images

title: (Untitled)
description: Hundreds of publishers, including The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Guardian, and Vox Media, run an ad campaign by the News/Media Alliance urging the government to protect content from AI. The campaign comes weeks after OpenAI and Google wrote letters to the government urging it to allow their AI models to train on copyrighted content

title: (Untitled)
description: Substack creates a new division of "Standards and Enforcement"

title: (Untitled)
description: X tightens rules around parody accounts, requiring them to use keywords such as "fake" or "parody" at the start of their account names and to use different images to the X accounts they are mimicking

title: (Untitled)
description: Bloomberg reports that Google's introduction of AI-generated answers and changes to its search algorithm have caused a significant decline in traffic to independent websites, disrupting the relationship between Google and publishers

title: (Untitled)
description: The BBC files a complaint with the U.K.'s Competition and Markets Authority asking it to require Apple and Google to more prominently credit news stories. In its complaint, the broadcaster wrote: “If audiences derive value from our content and services but attribute that value to gatekeepers instead of the BBC, then that undermines the perceived value of the BBC"

title: (Untitled)
description: A judicial panel on multidistrict litigation consolidates twelve copyright cases against OpenAI and Microsoft in New York, despite most of the authors and news outlets involved opposing centralization. The transfer order states the cases “share factual questions arising from allegations that OpenAI and Microsoft used copyrighted works, without consent or compensation, to train their large language models (LLMs) … which underlie defendants’ generative artificial intelligence products” such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT and Microsoft’s Copilot

title: (Untitled)
description: A study by researchers from the University of Washington, the University of Copenhagen and Stanford University finds that GPT-4 showed signs of having "memorized" portions of popular fiction books as well as portions of New York Times articles

title: (Untitled)
description: President Trump announces he will postpone enforcement of the TikTok sale-or-ban law for 75 more days

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta's chief global affairs officer, Joel Kaplan, announces that the platform's fact-checking program, as well as its associated penalties, are officially over in the U.S. The program will be replaced with Community Notes, with no penalties attached

title: (Untitled)
description: Press Gazette reports that Meta is profiting off scams on Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp that use the likenesses of high-profile figures, including journalists like CNN news anchor Richard Quest and Financial Times columnist Martin Wolf, to promote a dubious investment group. Facebook receives advertising revenue by promoting the fraudulent group and appears to have taken little action to curb it

title: (Untitled)
description: The UK editor of The Independent says stories on its new AI summarization service, Bulletin - which uses Google's Gemini to rewrite stories into a list of bullet points - often outperform the human-written content on which they are based

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube updates Shorts with features similar to those found on TikTok and Reels that aim to make it easier for creators to edit sort-form videos. This includes a new video editing timeline and automatic music syncing

title: (Untitled)
description: Digiday reports publishers aren't happy with the amount of ad revenue they receive from Apple News, compared to the engagement they see on the platform - despite the platform's push to sell more ad inventory

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook removes mention of "gender identity and expression" from its policy on hate speech

title: (Untitled)
description: A Welsh journalist finds that Google's AI Overviews presented a fake story he published on April Fool's Day as real information

title: (Untitled)
description: The editorial director of Newsquest, the second largest publisher of regional and local newspapers in the U.K., says the company employs 36 "AI-assisted" reports across its title. The reporters use an AI-powered CMS to rewrite press releases into stories, and are tasked with checking the facts and quotes are correct in the output

title: (Untitled)
description: WordPress.com parent company Automattic lays off 16 percent of its workforce - around 280 staff members - to “protect Automattic’s long-term future"

title: (Untitled)
description: Google's NotebookLM adds a feature that allows it to search the web and "Discover sources" on users' behalf

links.url: Google's NotebookLM adds a feature that allows it to search the web and "Discover soruces" on users behalf

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI drops its blanket prohibition on generating photorealistic images of public figures. The company stipulates that "public figures who wish for their depiction not to be generated can opt out" and prohibits users from generating images of public figures in violent, erotic or otherwise harmful scenarios

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok shuts down its Instagram competitor, TikTok Notes, and directs users to ByteDance-owned Lemon8

title: (Untitled)
description: Joelle Pineau, Meta's vice president of AI research, announces she will be leaving the company

title: (Untitled)
description: Skylight - a TikTok alternative built on top of the AT Protocol, which also underpins Bluesky - launches its mobile app

title: (Untitled)
description: A cybersecurity team discovers a data breach leaking the metadata and email addresses of over 200 million X users

title: (Untitled)
description: A sizable slowdown in traffic referrals from traditional search engines is unlikely to be offset by new AI search platforms in the foreseeable future, if ever, according to Similarweb data shared with Axios

title: (Untitled)
description: Substack rolls out a scrollable, TikTok-like video feed on its app

title: (Untitled)
description: Amazon releases Nova Act, a general-purpose AI agent that can take control of a web browser and independently perform simple actions. The agent will power key features of the company's generative AI-enhanced version of the company's voice assistant, Alexa

title: (Untitled)
description: An analysis of incidents and failures involving AI worldwide finds that the highest number of issues involve the media and entertainment sector. Many of these cases involve copyright disputes

title: (Untitled)
description: Bloomberg issues corrections for at least three dozen AI-generated summaries of its articles

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk says he sold his social media company, X, to xAI, his AI company. xAI will pay $45 billion for the social platform, slightly more than Musk paid for it in 2022, but the new deal also includes $12 billion of debt

title: (Untitled)
description: An examination of a large number of ChatGPT responses finds that the model's outputs show a noticeable shift to the political right

title: (Untitled)
description: Spotify expands its Partner Program to nine new markets - France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Ireland, New Zealand, Germany, Austria, and Switzerland

title: (Untitled)
description: UK-based agency Newsflare withdraws a number of videos it distributed that appear to have been generated using AI

title: (Untitled)
description: Tow Center: Section 230 Is Under Attack (Again)

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube changes how it counts views to reflect the number of times a creator's Short starts to play or play, rather than counting only after a Short has been viewed for a certain number of seconds

title: (Untitled)
description: News/Media Alliance announces an AI licensing partnership with ProRata, which allows members to opt into a content license with the startup for use with its Gist.AI product. ProRata’s attribution technology will identify when publisher content is used in generative AI answers, attribute the information to them, and pay them 50% of revenues for the use of their content

title: (Untitled)
description: AOL.com's AI-generated captions for syndicated content produce "cutesy" captions to a photo of a man charged with attempted murder

title: (Untitled)
description: Allure Magazine launches a Substack newsletter, hoping to take advantage of the platform's newsletter discovery tools like recommendations and Notes to reach readers where they're at

title: (Untitled)
description: Several Gannett-owned publications in the Boston area implement Espresso, "an AI tool that helps reporters “draft polished articles from community announcements." The lack of transparency around how these tools are deployed and overseen has raised questions about the publications' use of the technology

title: (Untitled)
description: 404 Media reports that Instagram is monetizing large quantities of  disturbing, AI-generated "brainrot" content

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI rolls out 4o image generation capable of producing more photorealistic outputs

title: (Untitled)
description: Some publishers observe an increase in traffic referrals from Threads

title: (Untitled)
description: WIRED investigation finds that OpenAI's AI video generator Sora "amplifies sexist stereotypes and ableist tropes, perpetuating the same biases already present in AI image tools"

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta agrees to stop targeting a UK citizen with personalized ads after agreeing to a settlement in a landmark privacy case that could set a precedent for millions of social media users

title: (Untitled)
description: X suspends several accounts belonging to opposition figures in Turkey amid widespread civil unrest in the country

title: (Untitled)
description: According to a settlement, newspaper company Lee Enterprises will pay $9.5 million for releasing personal information to Meta without customers' consent

title: (Untitled)
description: According to tests by the Washington Post, X's AI chatbot Grok often contradicts Elon Musk on topics including immigration and diversity, equity and inclusion

title: (Untitled)
description: Italian newspaper Il Foglio experiments with producing a fully AI-generated newspaper insert, which is found to contain inaccuracies, typos and inadequate citations

title: (Untitled)
description: Anthropic adds real-time web search to Claude

title: (Untitled)
description: Bluesky changes how it sends referral traffic to make it easier for publishers to track when visitors to their site came by way of a link shared on the social network

title: (Untitled)
description: Anthropic rolls out web search feature for its AI chatbot, Claude, which appears to be using Brave to power its web search

title: (Untitled)
description: Tow Center: The Battle over AI and Copyright Enters a New Phase

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI releases new speech-to-text and text-to-speech audio models in its API

title: (Untitled)
description: Newsletter platform Ghost connects to the Fediverse via a new ActivityPub integration

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta rolls out its AI tool across 41 European countries as well as 21 overseas territories, featuring a chat function in six European languages

title: (Untitled)
description: European Commission charges Google Search with breaking EU antitrust laws by favoring its own Shopping, Hotels, and Flights search services over rival comparison providers

title: (Untitled)
description: The Independent launches a newsroom service called Bulletin that uses Google AI tools to generate summaries of its articles for "time-poor audiences," which will be reviewed and checked by journalists before publication

title: (Untitled)
description: Google adds its Audio Overview - which can turn documents, slides and Deep Research reports into podcasts - to Gemini

title: (Untitled)
description: Google publishes the findings from an experiment in which it removed results from news organizations in Search, Discover, and Google News, and found that Search ad revenue did not change despite daily average users declining. News industry experts question the design of the trial, suggesting it was not well constructed to assess the value of news to Google's platforms

title: (Untitled)
description: A federal appeals court in Washington, D.C. affirms that art generated by AI without human input cannot be copyrighted under U.S. law

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, acquires a startup working on AI-powered video generation tools

title: (Untitled)
description: UK media watchdog Ofcom begins enforcing new rules designed to protect internet users from illegal content and harmful activity online

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram experiments with AI-generated comments on posts

title: (Untitled)
description: Beehiiv introduces a new tool called Direct Sponsorships that will allow creators to manage relationships with advertisers, giving them the ability to insert ads directly into their newsletters, set rate cards, coordinate inventory and send invoices

title: (Untitled)
description: Following Google and OpenAI's public comments urging the Trump administration to weaken copyright protections for AI training, the News/Media submits a comment urging the government to protect intellectual property rights in AI development. Additionally, dozens of newspapers owned by Alden Global Capital run editorials criticizing the companies for trying to gut copyright protections

title: (Untitled)
description: Google and OpenAI call on the U.S. government to weaken copyright restrictions and codify "fair use" for AI training

title: (Untitled)
description: Google makes Deep Research available to all users for free in more than 45 languages

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook rolls out new monetization option that allows creators to earn money for views on public stories

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta uses a nondisparagement agreement to prevent a former public policy chief from promoting the book she wrote about the company

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta begins testing Community Notes across Facebook, Instagram and Threads in the US. The company states that it expects the feature to be "less biased than the third-party fact-checking program it replaces because it allows more people with more perspectives to add context to posts"

title: (Untitled)
description: Search engine company Brave Software sues News Corp, seeking to forestall a lawsuit by the publisher for when readers are directed to copyrighted articles from the Wall Street Journal and New York Post. News Corp had sent the company a cease-and-desist letter threatening litigation and demanding compensation for the alleged misappropriation of copyrighted articles by "scraping" its websites and indexing their content

title: (Untitled)
description: Google enables personalization on Gemini to automatically analyze users' queries to see if referring to their Search history can "enhance" its response

title: (Untitled)
description: Snapchat releases its first video generative AI lenses powered by its in-house generative video model

title: (Untitled)
description: User Mag reports that Meta restricted the distribution of an article about Elon Musk's government takeover, marking it as 'sensitive or controversial content'

title: (Untitled)
description: Leading French publishing and authors' associations file a lawsuit against Meta for allegedly using their copyrighted content to train its AI models

title: (Untitled)
description: Several Boston area newspapers owned by Gannett announce the use of an AI tool called Espresso “designed to draft polished articles from community announcements"

title: (Untitled)
description: U.K. competition authority finds that Apple and Google's duopoly in the mobile browser space is "holding back innovation" and could be limiting economic growth

title: (Untitled)
description: Yale University suspends a scholar at its law school after an AI-powered news site alleged that she is linked to Samidoun, a group the U.S. government has said funds terrorists

title: (Untitled)
description: Spain's government approves a bill imposing massive fines on companies that use AI-generated content without properly labeling it as such

title: (Untitled)
description: Liberal watchdog organization Media Matters sues Elon Musk's X for breach of contract over Musk bringing suits against the nonprofit in Texas, Ireland and Singapore for what it calls "a vendetta-driven campaign of libel tourism"

title: (Untitled)
description: Bluesky adds support for three-minute videos and a DM filter that allows users to approve or reject messages from unknown users

title: (Untitled)
description: Reddit announces a new tool called Rules Check intended to help users assess whether their post violates a subreddit's rules

title: (Untitled)
description: News Organizations Are Starting to Embrace Creator-Model Journalists

title: (Untitled)
description: An audit by NewsGuard finds that leading AI tools advanced Russian propaganda by repeating false claims from the pro-Kremlin Pravda network

title: (Untitled)
description: ​A study by the Tow Center for Digital Journalism that evaluated eight AI-powered search engines finds that all performed poorly in accurately retrieving and citing news content. The research highlights issues such as frequent inaccuracies, fabricated links, and the bypassing of publisher restrictions, raising concerns about the reliability of these AI tools in handling news information

title: (Untitled)
description: Politico Pro rolls out the Policy Intelligence Assistant, an AI tool that allows its subscribers to generate detailed policy reports using data pulled exclusively from Politico reporting and analysis

title: (Untitled)
description: The Lenfest Institute and the Google News Initiative announce a grant opportunity that will provide grants of up to $25,000 to Lenfest Community of Practice members and access to the Google News Initiative’s suite of tools, training, and resources

title: (Untitled)
description: Google announces the expansion of AI Overviews and the testing of an "AI Mode" that returns only generated answers and no links

title: (Untitled)
description: Hyperlocal digital news platform Patch uses AI newsletters to expand its reach from 1,100 U.S. communities to 30,000 in several months

title: (Untitled)
description: After the Los Angeles Times adds AI-powered counterpoints to its opinion pieces, with the intention of providing "alternative perspectives," users identify various strange outputs, such as a defense of the KKK

title: (Untitled)
description: Study finds that 42% of journalists surveyed are using generative AI tools at work that are not licensed by their company, or "shadow AI"

title: (Untitled)
description: Generative AI tools like ChatGPT and Perplexity send little traffic to news publishers, according to an analysis of Comscore data

title: (Untitled)
description: A report by content licensing startup Tollbit finds that AI search engines send 96% less referral traffic to news sites and blogs than traditional Google search; meanwhile, AI developers' scraping of websites has more than doubled in recent months

title: (Untitled)
description: Gannett announces plans to hire an “AI Sports Editor” and “AI-Assisted Sports Reporter” despite recent controversies related to the use of AI in sports reporting

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram alternative Flashes launches its Bluesky-based photo-sharing app on the App Store

title: (Untitled)
description: Tow Center: Will Elon Musk Break with Community Notes?

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta apologizes for an "error" after Instagram users report a flood of graphic and disturbing content recommended on their feeds

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok revamps its desktop platform with the addition of several new features including a new modular layout, refreshed For You feed, a new Explore tab, immersive full-screen live gaming streaming, and a floating video player

title: (Untitled)
description: ElevenLabs releases Scribe, its first Speech to Text model, which transcribes speech in 99 languages

title: (Untitled)
description: Amazon launches the generative AI version of its voice assistant Alexa, called Alexa Plus

title: (Untitled)
description: Unionized journalists at three Gannett-owned newspapers in New Jersey vote to walk out to protest bad-faith bargaining, alleging, among other things, that the publisher is instituting artificial intelligence policies that are affecting the newspaper’s working conditions. A week later, they reach a tentative agreement that includes guardrails around the use of AI

title: (Untitled)
description: A U.S. judge says Rumble need not comply with a Brazilian judge's order that it remove U.S.-based accounts of a leading supporter of former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro

title: (Untitled)
description: Google rolls out a free version of Gemini Code Assist for solo developers

title: (Untitled)
description: A study of Facebook's search feature finds that nearly half of English language words that should violate Meta's Community Standards triggered search interventions, whereas only a fifth of similar Spanish words did

title: (Untitled)
description: A study finds that pages that get featured in Google’s AI Overviews benefit from more referral traffic, while those excluded lose clicks

title: (Untitled)
description: Major newspapers across the UK blanket their covers with the text "MAKE IT FAIR," in protest of government proposals that could eviscerate copyright protections against artificial intelligence

title: (Untitled)
description: Dow Jones' AI marketplace, which allows publishers to license their content to corporations, reaches 5000 publishing partners

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook's new Channels feature allows publishers to use direct messaging on the platform to distribute content to their audiences

title: (Untitled)
description: ProPublica reports that Meta decided to stop working with U.S. fact-checkers at the same time as it revamped a program to pay bonuses to creators with high engagement numbers, potentially pouring accelerant on the kind of false posts the company once policed

title: (Untitled)
description: Anthropic releases a new frontier AI model called Claude 3.7 Sonnet, designed to “think” about questions for as long as users want it to

title: (Untitled)
description: Digiday reports that referral traffic from AI platforms grows despite publishers’ attempts to block crawlers

title: (Untitled)

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube adds generative AI video features that creators can use when making shorts

description: DeepSeek releases a new set of multimodal AI models

description: Nieman Lab investigates a network of AI-generated newsletters called "Good Daily," which operates in 355 U.S. cities and towns, presenting itself as localized news sources like "Good Day Fort Collins." The newsletters, managed by a single individual named Matthew Henderson, use large language models to curate and summarize local news without disclosing their AI-driven nature

title: (Untitled)

description: Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Twitch, X, YouTube, Snapchat, LinkedIn and others sign the "Code of Conduct on Countering Illegal Hate Speech Online Plus," a revised set of voluntary commitments associated with the European Commission's Digital Services Act. The Verge reports that "the revised code commits signatories to transparency around hate speech detection and reduction, to allowing third-party monitors to assess how hate speech notices are reviewed by the platforms, and to review 'at least two-thirds of hate speech notices' within 24 hours"

description: DoubleVerify, a software platform tracking online ads and media analytics, identifies a network of over 200 websites - which it dubs "Synthetic Echo" - that has been using AI-generated content and plagiarized articles to mimic reputable sports news outlets like ESPN, NBC, Fox, CBS, and the BBC. The sites deceive readers and divert advertising revenue from legitimate media by employing domain names and designs that closely resemble established brands, such as BBCSportss)

title: (Untitled)
description: Following The Guardian's departure from X, French regional newspaper groups Ouest-France and Sud Ouest also suspended their activity on the platform, citing issues of lack of moderation and rampant misinformation

description: Elon Musk confirms that X deprioritizes posts containing links in their main text, fueling criticism that the platform is restricting the visibility of and access to external sources of information

description: The Communications and Digital Committee of the UK Parliament issues a report calling for "updated legislation to help news providers strike mutually beneficial deals with AI firms. This should include transparency measures to let rightsholders check if their material has been used to train AI, alongside new sanctions for rule-breaking."

title: (Untitled)
description: X users find that they are unable to follow the account of Palestinian journalist Younis Tirawi

title: (Untitled)

description: Anthropic open-sources its Model Context Protocol (MCP), "a new standard for connecting AI assistants to the systems where data lives, including content repositories, business tools, and development environments"

title: (Untitled)
description: The Australian government drops its plans to fine internet platforms up to 5% of their global revenue for failing to prevent the spread of misinformation online after critics compare it to censorship

description: Lawyers for The New York Times and Daily News, which are suing OpenAI for copyright infringement, say the company's engineers accidentally deleted data potentially relevant to the case

title: (Untitled)

description: Tow Center: "Journalists Are Leaving X for Bluesky. Will They Stay There?"

title: (Untitled)
description: Nick Pickles, who resigned from his role as head of global affairs at X, is hired as chief policy officer for OpenAI co-founder Sam Altman's company Tools for Humanity

title: (Untitled)
description: Data shows that X offset the users it lost post-Election Day with a 27% surge in new downloads

title: (Untitled)

description: Google's Gemini chatbot rolls out "memory" feature to certain users, which is intended to add context to conversations

description: Meta creates a new AI product group that will develop AI tools for the businesses that use its apps

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta's Oversight Board decides to "allow third-party imagery of terrorist attacks," with a warning, "when posts condemn or share information on these acts"

title: (Untitled)
description: The New York Times' podcast 'The Daily' ranks as the most popular podcast of 2024 on Apple Podcasts

description: A wave of news publishers follow audiences from X to Bluesky amid post-election "X exodus"

title: (Untitled)
description: Indian news agency Asian News International (ANI) sues OpenAI for unauthorized use of its content

title: (Untitled)
description: Google updated its Site Reputation Abuse policy to close a loophole that publishers had been using for years to generate passive affiliate revenue. Publishers will no longer be able to allow third-party vendors to publish content - typically product recommendations with affiliate links - on their websites to exploit their Google ranking

title: (Untitled)
description: Mistral unveils new AI models and chat features, including live search with in-line citations

title: (Untitled)
description: Buzzfeed's AI-powered ad platform recommends products that attempt to match objects in disturbing images on its site, reports 404 Media

title: (Untitled)
description: A study by the Pew Research Center on news content creators finds that nearly 40% of U.S. adults under the age of 30 regularly get news from news influencers and that the majority of news influencers are men, most of whom have never worked for a news organization

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI is paying Dotdash Meredith a minimum of around $16 million per year to license its content, according to public financial documents from the publisher's parent company

title: (Untitled)
description: Mastodon, like other text-based social platforms, sees a boost from the post-election "X exodus." Signups to the platform increased by 27% month-over-month in November

description: A new study finds that X may have tweaked its algorithm to boost Elon Musk's account, along with those of other conservative-leaning users, starting around the time he announced his support of Donald Trump’s reelection campaign

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook makes "views" its primary metric to measure the performance of content, regardless of format

description: Google says it will stop showing political ads to users in the EU due to uncertainties around the bloc's new transparency regulations

description: An analysis by Poynter of the 3,637 Community Notes made on X on Election Day shows that users found the platform’s moderation instrument to be mostly unhelpful

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube allows users to buy "jewels" to exchange for gifts for their favorite creators during livestreams, a feature that is reminiscent of TikTok's livestream gifting

description: Mahmoud Reza Banki is named chief financial officer of X

description: Spotify announces that starting January 2, 2025, it will begin paying creators based on how much engagement their videos receive from paid subscribers. The platform will also turn off automated ad breaks in videos for paid users to encourage more consumption and compete more directly with YouTube

title: (Untitled)
description: Media executives tell the Financial Times that some brands are preparing to return to X to advertise, given Elon Musk's likely influential role within a second Trump White House

title: (Untitled)
description: The Wall Street Journal experiments with AI-generated article summaries that appear at the top of its news stories. The summaries include a message explaining that they were created by an AI tool and checked by an editor

description: NBC News reports that the day after the U.S. election, X experienced its largest user exodus since Elon Musk bought the platform in 2022. Users have instead been embracing alternative text-based social media platforms like Bluesky and Threads

description: News Corp's business intelligence search engine Factiva adds generative AI summaries to its search results using Google's Gemini technology. The publisher signed a three-year partnership with Google in 2021 that included payments for content via Google News Showcase and technology sharing

title: (Untitled)
description: The Guardian announced it will no longer post on any of its official accounts on X, calling it a "toxic media platform" and accusing Elon Musk of using its influence to shape political discourse

description: Google tests the impact of removing news articles from EU-based publishers from search results

description: President-elect Donald Trump taps Elon Musk to lead the new Department of Government Efficiency along with Vivek Ramaswamy. Trump says the department will drive "drastic change" in the government, with major cuts and new efficiencies in bloated agencies in the federal bureaucracy

title: (Untitled)
description: Publishers' affiliate businesses experience dramatic falls in search visibility on Google due to a new policy aiming to crack down on affiliate businesses run by third-party companies

title: (Untitled)

description: Following the 2024 U.S. election, Bluesky sees a surge in new accounts, emerging as an alternative to X

description: Shailesh Prakash, a Google executive picked to supercharge news efforts at the company, resigns from his position

title: (Untitled)

description: Mistral launches a new API for content moderation that can be tailored to specific applications and safety standards

description: YouTube viewers watch 84 million hours of U.S. presidential election news, representing 80.6% of the overall streamlining audience, according to Stream Charts, a database of live streaming statistics and analytics. Rumble, which is popular with conservatives, comes in second place with 13.1% and sets new high marks in a variety of categories, including the number of live streams, live concurrent views, consumption, total Rumble Premium subscribers, and revenue generated through the Rumble Advertising Center

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk looks set to take up an influential adviser role in the White House, reports the Financial Times

description: Tow Center: The final stretch of the election in a content-moderation void

description: Nvidia exceed Apple's market capitalization to become the world's largest company

description: Russia fines Google more than $20 undecillion (trillion trillion) after the platform failed to pay fines, which are now accruing, for blocking pro-Russian channels on YouTube

title: (Untitled)
description: Though Elon Musk has touted the crowdsourced Community Notes program as a superior alternative to content moderation, research by the nonprofit Center for Countering Digital Hate and the Washington Post finds that a majority of fact checks proposed by users on political posts are not shown to the public. This suggests the feature is failing to provide a meaningful check on misinformation at a critical moment

title: (Untitled)
description: An investigation by AI Democracy Projects finds a disparity in the accuracy of English and Spanish responses to election-related questions produced by five leading AI models. The models responded to prompts written in English with information about U.S. elections, but if the same questions were asked in Spanish, the models returned information related to elections in Spanish-speaking countries

title: (Untitled)
description: New X users with interests in topics such as crafts, sports and cooking are being blanketed with political content and fed a steady diet of posts that lean toward Donald Trump and that sow doubt about the integrity of the U.S. election, finds a Wall Street Journal analysis

description: Snapchat adds 37 million daily active users in its third quarter, totaling 443 million. Time spent watching content increases by 25 percent over the previous year

title: (Untitled)
description: An analysis by the Washington Post of the 100 top-tweeting congressional accounts finds that while top political accounts on X have seen declines in audience, Republicans have seen huge spikes in follower counts over Democrats, and their tweets have collectively received billions more views since July 2023

description: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer writes in a letter to the News Media Association that his government "recognises the basic principle" that publishers should seek compensation for use of their content by AI companies, and that he hopes to "rebalance" the relationship between platforms and publishers using the country's Digital Markets and Consumers Act

title: (Untitled)
description: Medium is experiencing an influx of AI-generated content - often related to fairly banal topics such as NFTs, web3, Ethereum and AI - finds a WIRED investigation. The platform's CEO Tony Stubblebine says this "doesn't matter" as long as Medium is containing the content with spam filtering and human moderation so that no one reads it

title: (Untitled)
description: In an effort to lower its reliance on Google Search and Microsoft's Big, Meta is working on its own AI search engine

title: (Untitled)

Google has tasked the Canadian Journalism Collective with distributing the funds

title: (Untitled)
description: X is on track to fall well short of its goal of bringing in $100mn in revenue from political advertising in 2024, raising just $15mn in the year to date, largely from an increasing reliance on Republicans and the Trump campaign, reports the Financial Times

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI's transcription tool Whisper is prone to making up chunks of text or entire sentences, finds an investigation by the Associated Press. Some of the invented text can include racial commentary, violent rhetoric and imagined medical treatments

title: (Untitled)
description: A new app called Loops aims to become the fediverse's answer to TikTok

description: Perplexity says it is now performing approximately 400 million queries every month, up from 250 million in July 2024

title: (Untitled)

title: (Untitled)
description: Mexican TikTok users who report on drug-related violence in the country use code words to avoid having their content removed, finds an investigation by Rest of World. While TikTok says words related to narco-violence do not violate community guidelines, creators say the platform's politics are unclear about which words can be used

title: (Untitled)
description: WIRED reports that generative search engines from Google, Microsoft and Perplexity have been surfacing "deeply racist and widely debunked research promoting race science and the idea that white people are genetically superior to nonwhite people"

title: (Untitled)
description: A Polish radio station, OFF Radio Kraków, sparks controversy after dismissing its journalists and relaunching it with AI-generated "presenters." Shortly after its launch, the channel airs an imagined, AI-generated interview with Wisława Szymborska, a Polish Nobel Prize-winning poet who died in 2012 which was reportedly authorized by the Wisława Szymborska Foundation. Despite initially scheduling the "experiment" to last for three months, the company decides to end it after less than a week following widespread backlash

title: (Untitled)
description: Google open-sources SynthID Text, a tool that allows developers to watermark and detect text written by generative AI models

title: (Untitled)
description: Speaking to the Wall Street Journal following a recent lawsuit by its parent company, Dow Jones, Perplexity CEO and founder Aravind Srinivas throws cold water on the idea of signing licensing agreements with publishers but instead emphasizes his desire to establish revenue-sharing partnerships

title: (Untitled)
description: Anthropic says its AI model Claude can now act as an autonomous agent to perform computing tasks including filling out forms, planning an outing and building a website

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI and Microsoft announce a $10 million AI collaborative and fellowship program operated by the Lenfest Institute, which will provide $500,000 each to Chicago Public Media, The Minnesota Star Tribune, Long Island Newsday, The Philadelphia Inquirer, and The Seattle Times. The program will cover the cost of hiring a two-year AI fellow to work on projects that focus on driving sustainable businesses for local news, as well as allow the outlets to use OpenAI and Microsoft Azure credits to experiment and develop AI tools

title: (Untitled)
description: More than 10,500 creative professionals - including musicians, actors and novelists - sign an open letter condemning the “unlicensed use of creative works” to develop AI systems

title: (Untitled)
description: Tow Center: "Q&A: The Backfire Effect—Is Fact-Checking Doing More Harm Than Good?"

description: Spotify pilots an ad exchange to help scale its advertising offerings

description: Twitch is pressured to admit that it blocked new users from Israel and Palestine from creating new accounts on the platform since Oct. 7, 2023, to prevent them from uploading "graphic material"

description: Dow Jones, the parent company of the Wall Street Journal, and the New York Post, sue Perplexity for copyright infringement. “This suit is brought by news publishers who seek redress for Perplexity’s brazen scheme to compete for readers while simultaneously freeriding on the valuable content the publishers produce, ” the publishers said in the complaint

title: (Untitled)
description: Ireland’s media and internet watchdog, Coimisiún na Meán, adopts an Online Safety Code that requires video-sharing platforms headquartered in the country - which include TikTok, YouTube, Instagram and Reels - to have terms of service that bans uploads or sharing of harmful content types

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta tests using facial recognition as a scam prevention measure to combat celebrity scam ads

description: X updates its privacy policy to indicate that it will allow third-party "collaborators" to train their AI models on X data unless users opt out. This policy change implies that the platform is looking to license data to AI companies as a potential new revenue stream

description: Google updates its note-taking and research assistant tool NotebookLM with the ability to guide the AI-generated audio conversation it produces and focus on specific topics

description: X will not be regulated under the European Union's Digital Markets Act, as the Commission deems it not an important gateway for businesses to reach customers

description: OpenAI's head of media partnerships, Varun Shetty, says the company does not currently intend to share ad revenue from its SearchGPT product with publishes whose content the tool surfaces. title: (Untitled)
description: Due to declines in traffic from platforms like Google and Facebook, staff at Reach Live's network of websites are being asked to write up to eight articles per day in an effort to improve engagement, reports Press Gazette. Digiday reports that while Reach's traffic from Google Search was down 25% year over year, the publication's referral from Google Discover went up enough to offset the search traffic decline. Reach's audience director of distribution says that currently 60 to 70% of Google-driven traffic to its site comes from Google Discover as opposed to Search

title: (Untitled)
description: X shifts its creator payments to prioritize engagement over ads. Rather than giving them a percentage of the ad revenue that comes from the ads shown in their replies, the platform will now pay creators directly based on engagement with their content that comes from its Premium users. This means creators will be incentivized to create posts that drive engagement

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI is planning to restructure as a public benefit corporation in an effort to defend itself from hostile takeovers and protect chief executive Sam Altman from outsider interference

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI strikes a content partnership with Hearst, which will allow the AI company to integrate content from more than 40 of the publisher's local newspapers and more than 20 of its magazine brands. The terms of the deal were not disclosed

title: (Untitled)
description: Among the 200 politically focused TikTok accounts with the most viral posts created in June and July 2024, garnering 25,000 or more views, one-fifth were news influencers, finds a Wall Street Journal analysis of data from social media research firm CredoIQ. "While viral posts from top-performing legacy media accounts still had broader overall reach, with more than 1.2 billion views, those mainstream outlets posted less frequently and had fewer viral videos than the group of news influencers," the Journal found

title: (Untitled)
description: New data from the Pew Research Center finds that typical American TikTok users follow very few - if any - politicians, journalists or traditional media outlets. The data also finds that content related to news, politics and current events is "quite rare" on the platform

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta's Oversight Board will launch Appeals Centre Europe to handle content disputes from European social media users on Facebook, YouTube and TikTok

title: (Untitled)
description: The U.S. Supreme Court will not hear an appeal from X over a search warrant prosecutors obtained in the election interference case against former President Donald Trump. The company says a nondisclosure order that blocked it from telling Trump about the warrant obtained by special counsel Jack Smith's team violated its First Amendment rights

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram head Adam Mosseri acknowledges that Threads has a problem with "engagement bait" and says that they are working to get it under control

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI's web crawlers aren't being blocked by top news outlets at the rate they once were. According to AI detection startup Originality AI, the number of publishers blocking the crawlers has dropped from a high of more than a third of popular news outlets to closer to a quarter

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok launches its AI-powered ad-buying tool Smart+, its answer to Google’s Performance Max and Meta’s Advantage+

title: (Untitled)
description: Substack hopes to position itself as "a central platform for paying creators of all kinds, untethered to the news cycle and beyond the tough-to-monetize medium of text," reports Semafor

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk claims the X handle "@America," which had long been registered by another user, to promote his pro-Trump super PAC, called America PAC

title: (Untitled)
description: As AI search startups and social video platforms like Perplexity and TikTok provide new offerings for advertisers, Google's grip on search is slipping. The research firm eMarketer predicts that Google’s share of the U.S. search ad market will drop below 50% in 2025

title: (Untitled)
description: TruthSocial has been "flooded with scammers who are swindling users out of enormous sums of money," according to Gizmodo, which has reviewed consumer complaints filed with the FTC over the past two years

title: (Untitled)
description: In the 10 weeks following Donald Trump's assassination attempt, advertisers paid Meta between $593,000 and $813,000 for political ads that explicitly mentioned the shooting, report CalMatters and The Markup, observing that real-world violence can open new revenue opportunities for the platform

title: (Untitled)
description: The Court of Justice of the European Union rules against Meta over personalized advertising, saying the platform "cannot use all of the personal data" it collects about users, as it is obliged to adhere to the principles of "data minimization" under the EU's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta announces a new AI-powered video generator called Movie Gen that can produce photorealistic clips with audio based on text prompts

title: (Untitled)
description: Google experiments with a new checkmark verification feature for its search product that is intended to make it easier to prevent users from clicking on fraudulent website links

title: (Untitled)
description: Google threatens to stop linking to New Zealand news articles and discontinue its agreements with local publishers if the country's government passes the Fair Digital News Bargaining Bill, which is intended to force tech companies to pay a fair price for the content that appears on their feeds

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook announces a series of changes intended to make the platform more appealing to younger users, including placing a greater emphasis on local community information, videos, and Facebook Groups

title: (Untitled)
description: The New York Times, The Guardian, and Forbes report seeing traffic referrals from Perplexity, despite having blocked the AI search engine's bots from crawling their content

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI launches a "Canvas" interface for ChatGPT that allows users to manually adjust sections of text or code generated by the chatbot in a side-by-side text box

title: (Untitled)
description: Google expands its Gemini Live, its conversational AI voice chat, to French, German, Portuguese, Hindi and Spanish

title: (Untitled)
description: Google's Lens tool now allows users to search with video and voice

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube announces that it will allow users to upload Shorts up to three minutes in length. It also introduces updates including video templates and a new Shorts trends page on mobile devices

title: (Untitled)
description: Google rolls out advertising on some of its AI-generated summaries, in a move that Bloomberg says is meant to show investors that costly artificial intelligence projects can generate revenue

title: (Untitled)
description: Google says its AI Overview is boosting publisher traffic thanks to a new feature that embeds direct links within the text of its overviews, though the platform stopped short of giving any more specifics about the increase publishers were seeing, reports AdWeek

title: (Untitled)
description: Tow Center: "Media leaders talk Big Tech, the AI future, and journalism"

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta says that creators on its platforms have earned over $2 billion this year, with payouts for Reels and other short videos growing over 80%. TechCrunch reports that these stats pale in comparison to YouTube, which has paid creators in its partner program $70 billion over the past three years

title: (Untitled)
description: Matthew Yglesias - a political writer who left Vox to start his Substack, Slow Boring, in 2014 - says the newsletter grosses around $1.4 million a year, with limited overhead

title: (Untitled)
description: Calling upon the Digital Services Act, the EU Commission requests information from YouTube, Snapchat, and TikTok about the parameters in their recommender systems

title: (Untitled)
description: Adam Mosseri, the head of Instagram, announces that users will have 15 minutes to make edits to their posts, meaning that for users who have opted into the fediverse, posts will be shared there at a 15-minute delay. In addition, fediverse users on Threads can now see who follows them and likes their content from other fediverse servers

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram releases a new feature for professional accounts called "best practices for creators" that offers personalized advice on how to make, share and monetize content on the platform

title: (Untitled)
description: Microsoft announces Copilot Daily, which generates audio summaries of current events and weather pulled from "authorized content sources." The publisher partners for the tool include Reuters, Axel Springer, Hearst Magazines, USA Today Network, and The Financial Times

title: (Untitled)
description: In the aftermath of Hurricane Helene, Facebook is flooded with photorealistic AI-generated images misrepresenting the destruction it caused

title: (Untitled)
description: Microsoft rolls out Bing generative search, its answer to Google's AI-powered overviews

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook and Instagram are losing value in the eyes of publishers, finds a survey by Digiday. Publishers' usage and ad spend on the platforms have fallen

title: (Untitled)
description: Reddit unveils a new policy prohibiting Reddit moderators from changing whether their subreddit is public or private without first submitting a request to the platform's admin. By requiring admin approval for the changes, Reddit is taking away a lever many communities used to protest the company’s API pricing changes last year

title: (Untitled)
description: Former NBC News and MSNBC anchor Brian Williams set to lead election night coverage on Amazon’s Prime Video, marking the streaming service's first foray into live news

title: (Untitled)
description: Politico launches a strategic partnership with an AI startup to develop a bespoke AI tool that will quickly summarize its journalism for subscribers to Politico Pro. The tool will aim to help users quickly pull together information from Politico and Politico Pro content to instantly create comprehensive reports on their topics of interest

title: (Untitled)
description: Fidelity estimates that X is now worth less than a quarter of the $44 billion Elon Musk bought it for

title: (Untitled)
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom vetoes the Safe and Secure Innovation for Frontier Artificial Intelligence Models Act (SB 1047) today. In his veto message, the governor cited multiple factors in his decision, including the burden the bill would have placed on AI companies, California’s lead in the space, and a critique that the bill may be too broad

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta restricts links on Threads, Instagram and Facebook that led to journalist Ken Klippenstein's newsletter containing a dossier on vice presidential candidate J.D. Vance that was allegedly nabbed in an Iranian hack of the Trump campaign. X also bans Klippenstein's account for "violating our rules against posting private information"

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta is fined $101.5M by Ireland's Data Protection Commission for a 2019 breach that exposed hundreds of millions of Facebook passwords

title: (Untitled)
description: Publishers fear the Snapchat forthcoming redesign, which will merge all of its media content into a TikTok-like feed, will deprioritize their content, impacting ad revenue and visibility. The app's shift to favor creators mirrors moves made by other platforms

title: (Untitled)
description: Italian media group GEDI inks a content licensing agreement with OpenAI. According to the press release, "[u]nder the partnership, ChatGPT users will have access to attributed quotes, content and links to GEDI’s publications, including La Repubblica and La Stampa"

title: (Untitled)
description: The Evening Standard, which recently made around 150 layoffs, raises eyebrows when it announces that it will be using AI to generate a review written in the style of dead art critic Brian Sewell

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI plans to restructure its core business into a for-profit benefit corporation that will no longer be controlled by its non-profit board

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta loses a bid to block a group of U.S. authors from questioning CEO Mark Zuckerberg in a lawsuit accusing the company of misusing copyrighted books to train its AI systems

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI’s executive exodus continues with three top leaders - including Chief Technology Officer Mira Murati - announcing their exits

title: (Untitled)
description: Though Elon Musk paints himself as a flag-bearer for free speech, under his leadership X has acceeded to government requests to take down or withhold user content at a significantly higher rate than it did in the years leading up to his purchase of the platform, according to its first transparency report under his ownership

title: (Untitled)
description: Reddit rolls out machine learning-powered translations to more than 35 new locales in Europe, Asia, and Latin America in a move designed to open the largely English-centric social network to more users

title: (Untitled)
description: New data collected by a recent newsroom cohort, hosted by Trusting News and Online News Association, shows a majority of news consumers want journalists to disclose how and why they used AI in their journalism

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok removes accounts belonging to Russian state media outlets RT and Sputnik for engaging in what it calls "covert influence operations"

title: (Untitled)
description: Traffic from Google Discover now exceeds traffic from Google Search for some publishers, though there is a lack of certainty about what kind of content performs well there

title: (Untitled)
description: British entertainment publisher Digitalbox launches a series of highly-targeted sites aiming to deliver the “super engagement which is increasingly favoured by the platforms”. Referring to Google’s E-A-T (Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trustworthiness) criteria, the publisher's chief executive James Carter said sites dedicated to specific football clubs were an example of the sort of content currently favored by the search engine

title: (Untitled)
description: The New York Times will make its audio subscription available for purchase through Apple Podcasts and Spotify. Starting in October, listeners will need to subscribe to The Times' audio content to unlock older episodes of shows such as "The Daily," "The Ezra Klein Show,"  "Modern Love," or "Hard Fork"

title: (Untitled)
description: As traffic to news sites falls sharply, outlets experiment with WhatsApp's Channels feature, which allows them to send links and headlines directly to followers

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI rolls out new voice assistant to all paid users of ChatGPT, after delaying the launch to work through potential safety issues

title: (Untitled)
description: Snap enters into an expanded partnership with Google Cloud to power generative AI experiences within Snapchat’s My AI chatbot. The chatbot will use the multimodal capabilities of Google’s Gemini AI to enable the chatbot to understand different types of information, like text, audio, images, and videos

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk loses a legal fight over unpaid severance to a former Twitter employee who was laid off when Musk took over the social media platform in 2022

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok rolls out its Search Ads Campaign tool, giving advertisers the ability to target ads based on what users are actively searching for

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok rolls out redesigned "Subscription" monetization offering, which competes with Patreon, Instagram Subscriptions and YouTube's channel membership by allowing regular creators to provide paying subscribers with exclusive content and other perks

title: (Untitled)
description: Despite the fact that TikTok has banned all political advertising on the app since 2019, NBC News found 52 videos on the platform tagged with either a “Paid Partnership” label, #ad or #sponsored that have received up to hundreds of thousands views per video while spreading political messages

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook angers Polish media outlets by removing images and text from their articles when they are posted on the platform. Facebook claims it has done so due to legal doubts over Poland’s implementation of an EU copyright directive, but a Polish publishers’ association accuses the company of “exploiting its dominant position” to “censor” content

title: (Untitled)
description: Telegram will provide users’ IP addresses and phone numbers to relevant authorities in response to valid legal requests, announces Chief Executive Officer Pavel Durov in the aftermath of his arrest in France for crimes committed on the app

title: (Untitled)
description: X makes posts available to blocked users. Owner Elon Musk says the "block function will block that account from engaging with, but not block seeing, public post.”

title: (Untitled)
description: A German courts reporter finds that Microsoft's Copilot chatbot falsely blamed him for the crimes whose trials he covered

title: (Untitled)
description: In an abrupt reversal, the X's lawyers say it will comply with Brazilian court orders that it had previously defied, meaning the country's Supreme Court could allow the site to return next week

title: (Untitled)
description: Following X's ban in Brazil, Tumblr reports an increase in both active users and blog creation. In the days since the ban, the platform's daily active users in Brazil rose by 30%

title: (Untitled)
description: X CEO Linda Yaccarino announces the launch of a new “video tab” feature that resembles a TikTok-style endless scroll

title: (Untitled)
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom signs bill to limit the ability of social media companies to provide "addictive feeds" to minors

title: (Untitled)
description: Twitch introduces new enforcement strategy in which strikes for certain offenses will depreciate over time, users will receive more information regarding their strikes, and users will be able to take educational courses to reduce the severity of enforcement actions

title: (Untitled)
description: AI companies' aggressive web crawling causes disruptions for websites and raises the costs of their cloud bills due to botnet traffic

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube announces a slate of news artificial intelligence features, including an Inspiration tab, which generates ideas, titles, and even full videos; a video generation tool; a new feature that will allow a creator’s existing viewers to help “hype” a video with a click of a button; and a revamp of its connected TV app

title: (Untitled)
description: Amazon launches an AI-powered video generator for advertisers

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk repeatedly amplified content from a company that appears to be at the center of an alleged Russian covert operation to manipulate U.S. public opinion ahead of the 2024 election

title: (Untitled)
description: While top executives from Alphabet, Meta and Microsoft testified at a Senate Intelligence Committee hearing on election threats, X did not participate

title: (Untitled)
description: A small but growing share of U.S. adults are regularly getting news on TikTok, according to a Pew Research Center analysis. Since 2020, no social media platform has seen faster growth in the share of Americans who regularly turn to it for news

title: (Untitled)
description: Snapchat reserves the right to put its users’ faces in ads, according to terms of service related to its “My Selfie” tool (formerly “AI Selfies”), which allows users and their friends to create AI-generated images trained on their selfies. Users have the option to opt out of this, but the feature is on by default

title: (Untitled)
description: Google announces plans to implement content authentication technology across its products to help users distinguish between human-created and AI-generated images. The platform will integrate the Coalition for Content Provenance and Authenticity (C2PA) standard, a system designed to track the origin and editing history of digital content, into its search, ads, and potentially YouTube services

title: (Untitled)
description: Snapchat announces a wholesale revamp of its app, promising a “simple” interface, a number of generative AI features, and a unified video entertainment experience, which will combine creator-driven videos and professionally-produced “Spotlight” videos in one place

title: (Untitled)
description: At least 26 U.S. states have passed or are considering bills regulating the use of generative AI in election-related communications

title: (Untitled)
description: Spotify makes efforts to encourage video-oriented creators to distribute their shows to the platform in addition to YouTube. Generally, it seems the company isn’t interested in acquiring the rights to produce the programming or exclusively sell ads on it; Spotify just wants the shows to be made available on its platform to beef up its video catalog

title: (Untitled)
description: About two-thirds of U.S. adults say they are not very or not at all confident that AI tools provide reliable and factual information, finds a survey from The Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research and USAFacts

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta reduces the prominence of AI labels for content modified or edited by AI tools across its platforms

title: (Untitled)
description: A company that owns several newspapers in Hawaii uses AI-generated newscasters to create video news segments, against the wishes of its unionized journalists, who say the newspaper’s owners are replacing journalists with AI and described the practice as “digital colonialism"

title: (Untitled)
description: Bluesky rolls out native support for video, allowing users to share videos of up to 60 seconds in length

title: (Untitled)
description: Google rolls out new experimental feature in Notebook LM that can generate "lively" podcast discussions based on uploaded documents

title: (Untitled)
description: Google Search adds links to archived websites in the Internet Archive’s Wayback Machine to add historical context to search results

title: (Untitled)
description: A former publishing executive testifies in an antitrust case against Google that the platform dominates online advertising because publishers have a lack of choice

title: (Untitled)
description: The European Union's top court rules that Apple and Google must pay billions in back taxes and antitrust fines, respectively, in two landmark cases

title: (Untitled)
description: During a scorching, relentless wildfire season, Facebook has been flagging and removing dozens of posts containing links and screenshots from Watch Duty, a widely relied-upon wildfire alert app, as well as from federal and state agencies, reports the Washington Post

title: (Untitled)
description: News/Media Alliance adds 26 new members - including BBC, CNN, The Economist, Future, The Guardian, and NBCUniversal News Group - as the battle for AI protections intensifies

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk's false posts about noncitizen voting spur officials to fact-check him, lead to requests to purge voter rolls, and add to worries about threats, election officials say

title: (Untitled)
description: A group of Democratic senators urges the FTC and Justice Department to investigate whether AI tools that summarize and regurgitate online content like news and recipes may amount to anticompetitive practices

title: (Untitled)
description: The Verge reports that ESPN's AI-generated stories are bland, basic and missing important nuance. For instance, a story about the National Women's League failed to mention the significance of one player’s final game and the emotional moments that happened as a result

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook admits to scraping all of the public data posted by adults on the platform since 2007 to train AI, with no opt-out option unless users are in the EU

title: (Untitled)
description: Tow Center: "AI companies have a news problem. Journalists have the skills they need to fix it."

title: (Untitled)
description: Nick Pickles, global affairs executive at X, leaves the platform after a decade at the company (previously known as Twitter)

title: (Untitled)
description: The Competition and Markets Authority provisionally finds that Google may have broken UK competition law by manipulating the digital advertising market to its advantage

title: (Untitled)
description: ESPN announces that it will use generative AI to produce text game recap stories of select sports events, which will appear on its digital platforms.
