The publisher says the AI-generated recaps aim to enhance coverage of under-covered sports, and that they will augment existing coverage, not replace it

title: (Untitled)
description: JournalismAI, a project of Polis – the journalism think-tank at the London School of Economics and Political Science – announces a new grant program with the Google News Initiative "to enable 35 news organisations around the world to experiment, implement and share best practice across AI technologies." The grants will be targeted in three areas to support AI tools and technologies: experimentation of new formats across mobile, video and audio; identification of ways to grow subscriptions and support diverse forms of revenue; and to fight misinformation

title: (Untitled)
description: Two weeks after Telegram's CEO, Pavel Durov, was arrested in France for allegedly allowing "criminal activity to go undeterred on the messaging app," the platform quietly removes language from its FAQ page saying private chats are protected and that it does not "process any requests related to them"

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube develops new "likeness management" technology that aims to give creators on the platform more control over content that copies their voice or likeness using generative AI

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI hits 1 million paid users for business versions of ChatGPT

title: (Untitled)
description: More than 25% of advertisers plan to cut advertising spending on X in 2025 because of concerns that extreme content on the platform could damage their brands

title: (Untitled)
description: A federal judge in San Francisco rules that roughly 150 older workers who were laid off by X when Elon Musk acquired the company can sue for age discrimination as a class, exposing the company to millions of dollars in potential damages

title: (Untitled)
description: Mehdi Hasan's Substack, Zeteo News, pulls in 31,000 paid subscribers - including more than 1,000 at the $500-and-up “founder” level, accounting for about $3 million in annualized revenue. Substack co-founder Hamish McKenzie calls the publication's launch “one of the most successful and fastest growing in Substack history"

title: (Untitled)
description: The Google News Initiative announces the renewal of its global partnership with FT Strategies. GNI says the partnership will support 1000 journalists and publishers globally by 2027, "helping them achieve digital transformation goals and develop sustainable business models"

title: (Untitled)
description: The independent Oversight Board for Instagram and Facebook rules that the phrase “from the river to the sea” is not necessarily hate speech when addressing the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. The ruling means that users on those platforms can continue to use the phrase in comments and posts, as long as there’s no overriding context that would otherwise be deemed problematic by Meta, such as violent language, legitimization of hate or calls for excluding others from territory

title: (Untitled)
description: Anthropic launches a new subscription plan for its AI chatbot, Claude, catered toward enterprise customers that want more administrative controls and increased security. Claude Enterprise will compete with OpenAI’s business-specific product, ChatGPT Enterprise

title: (Untitled)
description: X wins an appeal to partially block a California law requiring social media companies to publish their policies for combating disinformation, harassment, hate speech and extremism

title: (Untitled)
description: The U.S. Justice Department says it will not pressure social media companies to remove or block content when the government shares information about foreign threats to national security or elections, after claims that platform companies were coerced in the past

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram adds the ability to leave comments on Instagram Stories

title: (Untitled)
description: Though it hasn't formally launched a publisher program, Reddit steadily rolls out products and resources aimed at courting media companies to increase their presence on the platform

title: (Untitled)
description: Bluesky added more than 2.6 million new users within five days following X's shutdown in Brazil.

title: (Untitled)
description: The improved version of Alexa that Amazon is expected to release in October will primarily be powered by Anthropic’s Claude artificial intelligence model, rather than its own AI

title: (Untitled)
description: Ahead of the U.S. presidential election, Google rolls out safeguards for Search AI Overviews, YouTube AI-generated summaries for Live Chat, Gems and image generation in Gemini. As part of the restrictions, these AI products will not respond to election-related topics

title: (Untitled)
description: A Brazilian Supreme Court justice orders the suspension of X in Brazil after Elon Musk refuses to name a legal representative in the country

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok adds new ways for users to signal what kinds of content they want to see on their For You pages

title: (Untitled)
description: New research suggests Google's AI Overviews are having a significant impact on the visibility of publishers within search results. The publisher content that fuels some Google answers is buried deep below AI summaries and sponsored results

title: (Untitled)
description: X marks some links to NPR's website as "unsafe" when users click through to read a story about an altercation between a Trump campaign staffer and an Arlington National Cemetery employee. X says the link was marked as a "false positive" and had been corrected

title: (Untitled)
description: Bluesky introduces “anti-toxicity” features that aim to help users protect themselves against harassment and dogpiling, such as an option for a user to detach their post from somebody else’s quote of it

title: (Untitled)
description: Less than three months after Apple quietly debuts a tool for publishers to opt out of its AI training, a number of prominent news outlets and social media platforms - including the The New York Times, The Financial Times, The Atlantic, Vox Media, the USA Today network and Condé Nast - have taken the company up on it

title: (Untitled)
description: Google says it will resume allowing some consumers - English-language users who pay for its Gemini Advanced product - to use its artificial intelligence models to generate images of people, after a scandal earlier this year prompted the company to suspend the feature

title: (Untitled)
description: Automattic shifts Tumblr's back end to WordPress

title: (Untitled)
description: Pavel Durov, the founder of Telegram, is charged in France with a wide range of crimes for failing to prevent illicit activity on the app, and barred from leaving the country. His indictment was a rare move by legal authorities to hold a top technology executive personally liable for the behavior of users on a major messaging platform, escalating the debate over the role of tech companies in online speech, privacy and security and the limits of their responsibility

title: (Untitled)
description: Apple cuts about 100 jobs across its digital services group, which includes teams that run Apple Books and Apple News

title: (Untitled)
description: Persecuted journalists in Venezuela use AI avatars to present the news in an effort to combat President Nicolás Maduro's media crackdown since the disputed election

title: (Untitled)
description: Following warnings from top election officials in the U.S. that X's AI chatbot was spreading election misinformation, X now directs users to vote.gov in responses to election-related questions

title: (Untitled)
description: Inflection AI allows users to export their conversations off its AI chatbot Pi, though it plans to cap free access to the chatbot

title: (Untitled)
description: A large swath of Facebook pages that embrace American patriotism are actually run by foreign click farmers, many of whom are based in Macedonia, who use AI to pump out "a near-endless ocean of clickbaity soup" in order to earn ad revenue, reports Forbes

title: (Untitled)
description: Mark Zuckerberg accuses the Biden administration of pressuring the social media group to “censor” certain COVID-19 content, including humor and satire, during the pandemic and says he intended to be politically “neutral” this election cycle

title: (Untitled)
description: Gannett will shut down Reviewed, its product reviews site, which had been accused of publishing AI-generated reviews without disclosure

title: (Untitled)
description: French authorities arrest Pavel Durov, the CEO of Telegram, in relation to the messaging app's looser content moderation policies and the company's reported unwillingness to cooperate with law enforcement. The arrest raises questions about what liability risks social media executives have over the content users share on their platforms

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta’s decision to limit the reach of “political” content on Instagram yielded an average 65% drop in the reach of several prominent accounts that regularly posted credible political content between March and May 2024, finds a survey by Accountable Tech

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta cancels plans for a premium mixed-reality headset intended to compete with Apple’s Vision Pro

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI hires former Meta executive Irina Kofman to head up strategic initiatives

title: (Untitled)
description: Midjourney now allows anyone create as many as 25 images on its website through a free trial

title: (Untitled)
description: New prime minister of Nepal overturns a ban on TikTok that his predecessor imposed in November 2023

title: (Untitled)
description: In a last-minute, closed-door deal, Google secures an agreement with California lawmakers to circumvent two legislative bills that would have required it and other tech companies to compensate local newsrooms in the state for using their content. Instead, the company agreed to pay $250 million over five years to support local newsrooms and the creation of an AI Accelerator program. The Media Guild of the West filed an opposition letter with the California legislature opposing the deal

title: (Untitled)
description: Federal judge orders X to unseal the list of shareholders involved with X Holdings Corp., giving the public an official look at the investors who aided Elon Musk's $44 billion purchase of the platform. Shareholders named in the document include some of Silicon Valley’s most prominent venture capitalists and entrepreneurs, as well as a fund linked with hip-hop mogul Sean “Diddy” Combs

title: (Untitled)
description: Federal judge in California dismisses a lawsuit accusing X of forcing out workers with disabilities after Elon Musk took over the company and barred employees from working remotely. The judge said the plaintiff in the proposed class action failed to show how Musk's mandate to return to the office specifically impacted employees with disabilities

title: (Untitled)
description: Sales representatives from Google have suggested advertisers target teenagers on YouTube, seemingly in violation of the platform’s own policies, reports ADWEEK. This activity goes beyond the the special arrangement between Meta and Google identified by the Financial Times earlier this month

title: (Untitled)
description: Snapchat rejects Australian governments push to raise the age for allowing teenagers on social media to 16 and says it should be left to companies such as Apple or Google to enforce, if the law changes

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI announces developers can now fine-tune GPT-4o with custom datasets to get higher performance at a lower cost for their specific use cases

title: (Untitled)
description: The $13 billion that Elon Musk borrowed to buy Twitter has turned into the worst merger-finance deal for banks since the 2008-09 financial crisis, reports the Wall Street Journal. The banks haven't been able to offload the debt without incurring major losses—largely because of X’s weak financial performance—leaving the loans stuck on their balance sheets

title: (Untitled)
description: The Washington Post publishes its first story built on the work of a new in-house AI tool called Haystacker that allows journalists to sift through large data sets — video, photo or text — to find newsworthy trends or patterns. In the story, the Post analyzed over 700 presidential and down-ballot campaign ads that mention immigration from the first half of the year and found that nearly 20% of the ads use footage and photos "that are outdated, lack context, or are paired with voice-overs and text that do not accurately depict what is shown on the screen."

title: (Untitled)
description: Google files lawsuits in British and American courts against Kremlin-owned broadcaster RT in an attempt to block a global legal battle over the channel’s removal from YouTube

title: (Untitled)
description: Condé Nast, the parent company of titles like Vogue, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler, GQ, Architectural Digest, Vanity Fair, Wired and Bon Appétit, becomes the latest publisher to announce a partnership with OpenAI

title: (Untitled)
description: Group of authors sues Anthropic, alleging it committed “large-scale theft” in training its chatbot Claude on pirated copies of copyrighted books

title: (Untitled)
description: Ofcom, the U.K.'s media regulator, increases hiring for its online safety workforce as concerns rise that the regulator lacks sufficient powers to curb the kinds of misinformation that sparked recent violent unrest in the country

title: (Untitled)
description: X closes its operations in Brazil due to "censorship concerns" by Brazilian judge Alexandre de Moraes. The platform claims Moraes secretly threatened one of the company's legal representatives in the South American country with arrest if it did not comply with legal orders to take down some content from its platform

title: (Untitled)
description: Threads announces new features, including the ability to store multiple drafts, a way to rearrange columns on the desktop, and audience insights

title: (Untitled)
description: Google makes its latest text-to-image AI model, Imagen 3, available to all U.S. users through its ImageFX platform

title: (Untitled)
description: Google expands its AI-generated summaries for search queries to Brazil, India, Indonesia, Japan, Mexico and Britain

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram failed to remove 93% of abusive comments directed at female politicians out of 1,000 examples flagged to the app for most likely violating its rules, according to a report from the nonprofit Center for Countering Digital Hate

title: (Untitled)
description: Less than three months before the U.S. election, Meta shuts down CrowdTangle, a tool that helped journalists, researchers, politicians and regulators understand how information spread on its platforms

title: (Untitled)
description: Telegram launches monthly paid subscriptions that users can purchase using the app’s digital currency, Stars, in order to get access to a creator’s extra content. The idea behind the feature is to allow creators to charge for extra or early access to content in a way that’s similar to Patreon

title: (Untitled)
description: Anthropic introduces prompt caching on its API, which remembers the context between API calls and allows developers to avoid repeating prompts

title: (Untitled)
description: X launches Grok-2 and Grok-2 mini in beta, which can now generate images from text prompts. The Verge reports that the tool appears to lack guardrails, and that image prompts that would be immediately blocked on other services are fine by Grok

title: (Untitled)
description: X CEO Linda Yaccarino says the platform will continue to pursue antitrust litigation against several major brands and an ad industry group, even after one of the lawsuit's defendants shut down

title: (Untitled)
description: The number of Substack journalists in news and politics making more than $1 million doubles since 2023, and is now in "double digits"

title: (Untitled)
description: The Harris campaign has been editing news headlines and descriptions within Google search ads that make it appear as if the Guardian, Reuters, CBS News and other major publishers are on her side, Axios reports

title: (Untitled)
description: The 2024 Democratic National Convention will be streamed using vertical video on TikTok, Instagram and YouTube, with the hope of drawing in younger viewers who get most of their news on their phones

title: (Untitled)
description: Twitch introduces video stories, allowing users to film 60-second videos in the Twitch mobile app or upload a video from their camera roll

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok has been sending inaccurate and misleading news-style alerts to users’ phones, including a false claim about Taylor Swift and a weeks-old disaster warning, intensifying fears about the spread of misinformation on the popular video-sharing platform

title: (Untitled)
description: Prediction marketplace Polymarket, which lets users bet on real-world events, partners with Perplexity to display news summaries of events. When users click on an event on Polymarket, they will now see a summary of news related to the event based on search results from Perplexity and have the ability to ask more questions using a search box

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk and Donald Trump's joint X Spaces event experiences technical difficulties, with Musk claiming that X was the target of a "massive DDoS attack" that had made it impossible for the Space to proceed as planned. However, former engineers at the company and outside experts cast doubt that the technical issues were caused by a cyberattack

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok announces it is adding group chats to the platform. Users can now create group chats with up to 32 people to chat and share content together

title: (Untitled)
description: Publishers redouble their presence as the platform rises in search visibility on Google. Some, such as Yahoo, Puck, and New York Times Opinion, launch new Reddit accounts, while others like Rolling Stone, The Philadelphia Inquirer, The Independent, the AP and Newsweek, restart existing accounts or dedicate more resources to them

title: (Untitled)
description: Study finds that several prominent progressive Instagram accounts saw their reach decline by 65% on average in the months following Meta Platforms Inc.’s move to subdue political content on the app

title: (Untitled)
description: Turkey restores access to Instagram after the company agrees to cooperate with authorities to address the government's concerns. Turkey is Instagram's fifth largest market in the world

title: (Untitled)
description: After Mediaite reports that it is impossible to search former President Donald Trump's old posts on X, formerly known as Twitter, the ability to search his posts is restored

title: (Untitled)
description: Former Twitter board member Omid Kordestani sues the social media company owned by Elon Musk, claiming that the billionaire refused to cash out more than $20 million worth of shares

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok rolls out referral scheme that allows U.S. users who invite their friends to the app to get steep discounts on goods like digital cameras and hair styling tools

title: (Untitled)
description: Former President Donald Trump, who at one point tried to ban TikTok, now uses it as a key part of his campaign

title: (Untitled)
description: News Corp, which recently signed a deal with OpenAI, takes legal steps against unspecified "AI aggressors... who are predatory in the confiscation of our content"

title: (Untitled)
description: Amazon strikes partnerships with TikTok and Pinterest that will enable the platforms' users to buy items from Amazon advertisers without leaving the respective apps

title: (Untitled)
description: Truth Social is increasingly reliant on revenue from an obscure corner of the ad market sometimes called "the patriotic economy" that caters to hard-core Trump fans and Christian conservatives, finds a New York Times investigation

title: (Untitled)
description: In a safety analysis, OpenAI acknowledges that its humanlike voice interface for ChatGPT may lure some users into becoming emotionally attached to the chatbot

title: (Untitled)
description: The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal and News UK debut proprietary AI-based advertising tools that aim to more effectively deliver advertisers' campaigns to the publishers' audiences, such as by using the tools to determine which inventory is brand-safe or which audience segments are most suited to a campaign

title: (Untitled)
description: Reporter at the Cody Enterprise resigns after being confronted with evidence that he used generative AI to fabricate quotes in his reporting

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk deletes a post on X in which he shared a fake article, mocked up to mimic The Daily Telegraph newspaper’s style, with the headline “Keir Starmer considering building ’emergency detainment camps’ on the Falkland Islands”

title: (Untitled)
description: X announces its top subscription tier, Premium+, will be "fully" ad-free

title: (Untitled)
description: The World Federation of Advertisers discontinues activities for the Global Alliance for Responsible Media following an antitrust lawsuit filed by Elon Musk's X against the company

title: (Untitled)
description: Perplexity donates $250,000 to Northwestern University's Medill School of Journalism towards research into the future of AI and news. The school's Knight Lab will also receive access to Perplexity’s data, staff and publisher partners so it can learn how news content shows up in the chatbot’s responses and how newsrooms are approaching AI

title: (Untitled)
description: The U.K.'s competition watchdog launches a formal merger inquiry into Amazon’s investment in Anthropic

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk agrees to pause EU data processing for X's AI chatbot, Grok

title: (Untitled)
description: Google worked on a marketing project for Meta that was designed to target 13- to 17-year old YouTube users with ads that promoted Instagram, violating Google's rules for marketing to minors

title: (Untitled)
description: In light of the surge of violent anti-immigration riots sweeping the U.K., Ofcom, the country's communications regulator, publishes an open letter urging social media platforms to take responsibility for harmful online content

title: (Untitled)
description: Ad exchanges are profiting off low-quality obituaries produced by content mills that are riddled with disturbing errors and appear to be AI-generated, finds a report by watchdog organization Check My Ads

title: (Untitled)
description: In a revised policy, Meta says that creators who violate the company’s Community Standards for the first time will be offered the option to take a new training course instead of receiving a formal warning

title: (Untitled)
description: X is accused of bias after prominent accounts advocating for Vice President Kamala Harris, such as "White Dudes for Harris," are labeled as spam or restricted on the platform

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram embraces the "photo dump" trend by rolling out the ability for users to add up to 20 photos or videos to their feed carousels

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram makes "views" the primary metric across all of its formats, meaning creators will be able to track the same metric across Reels, Stories, photos and more

title: (Untitled)
description: Telegram faces renewed pressure to tackle extremist groups on its platform in the UK as it emerges as one of the man tools wielded for mobilizing right-wing rioters and stoking unrest following the stabbing deaths of three girls in Southport

title: (Untitled)
description: Automattic, the owner of WordPress.com, launches a new AI tool designed to help bloggers write more clearly and succinctly

title: (Untitled)
description: X files federal antitrust lawsuit against an advertising industry coalition and its members, alleging the group abused its influence over marketers and ad agencies to unfairly discriminate against X, prompting an ad boycott

title: (Untitled)
description: Publishers including the Financial Times, Axel Springer, The Atlantic and Fortune agree to license their content to ProRata.ai, a generative AI startup that claims it can accurately attribute and share revenue with content owners from AI chatbot subscriptions. The startup is building an AI chatbot and plans to share half the revenue from subscriptions with its content licensing partners

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI founder John Schulman leaves the company to join rival firm Anthropic

title: (Untitled)
description: Axios lays off 50 people, or about 10% of its employees, citing "shifting reader attention and behavior" and the threats posed to its business model by AI models' ability to summarize news

title: (Untitled)
description: British officials face resistance from X over calls to take down posts that are deemed a threat to national security, following the outbreak of far-right riots in response to the stabbing of three girls in Southport

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook is paying creators in India, Vietnam and the Philippines for bizarre AI spam that they are learning to make from YouTube influences and guides sold on Telegram, reports 404 Media

title: (Untitled)
description: Reddit CEO announces plans to test AI-powered search result pages to “summarize and recommend content"

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk files a lawsuit accusing OpenAI's executives of tricking him and other investors into supporting a company aimed at bettering humanity but then pivoting to becoming a for-profit enterprise

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok agrees to withdraw a rewards feature after the EU raised concerns about its potential to encourage excessive screentime, especially among children

title: (Untitled)
description: Former president and Republican nominee Donald Trump calls for his supporters to stop using Google, calling the search engine "illegitimate" and claiming the platform is interfering with efforts to find information about him

title: (Untitled)
description: A teenager from New York files a lawsuit seeking class-action status against Meta, alleging the company sought to keep teens hooked on Instagram while knowingly exposing them to harmful content

title: (Untitled)
description: Five secretaries of state send Elon Musk a letter urging him to fix Grok, X's AI chatbot, which has produced false information about state ballot deadlines. According to the letter, the misinformation was shared across multiple social media platforms and reached millions of people

title: (Untitled)
description: Nvidia scraped video from YouTube, Netflix and several other sources to compile training data for its AI products, reports 404 Media. The company defends its practice as being "in full compliance with the letter and the spirit of copyright law"

title: (Untitled)
description: Federal judge rules that Google acted illegally to maintain a monopoly in online search. The ruling was the first antitrust decision of the modern internet era in a case against a technology giant

title: (Untitled)
description: A YouTube creator files a class action lawsuit against OpenAI, alleging that the company trains its generative AI models on millions of transcripts from YouTube videos without notifying or compensating the videos' owners

title: (Untitled)
description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro asks his supporters to remove WhatsApp from their phones, claiming it's being used by "fascists" to spread violence. He also said TikTok and Instagram are being used to promote "hate" and vowed to regulate their use

title: (Untitled)
description: Two months after the Atlantic signs a licensing deal with OpenAI, dozens of its journalists sign a letter calling on the publisher to "stop prioritizing its bottom line and champion the Atlantic's journalism" and demanding management to include AI protections in their union contract

title: (Untitled)
description: The U.S. government alleges in a lawsuit against TikTok that the platform has failed to stop children from joining the app and has unlawfully collected their personal data

title: (Untitled)
description: Turkey blocks access to Instagram for failing to comply with the country's "laws and rules" and public sensitivities. The move follows accusations by a senior Turkish official that the platform blocked condolence posts following the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh

title: (Untitled)
description: Futurism reports that ChatGPT is citing plagiarized versions of New York Times articles copied by a notorious Armenian news pirater, instead linking to the original reporting

title: (Untitled)
description: Former CNN anchor Don Lemon sues Elon Musk and X, arguing Musk refused to pay him after a content deal with the platform fell apart following a testy interview between the two

title: (Untitled)
description: Microsoft, which has a long and tangled history with OpenAI, calls the AI startup a "competitor" for the first time in an SEC filing

title: (Untitled)
description: Despite forecasts that Amazon Prime Day would fall flat this year, several publishers tell Digiday that revenue earned from affiliate coverage of the sales event exceeded expectations, though commerce remains hard to predict

title: (Untitled)
description: Microsoft and Reddit offer conflicting explanations for why Microsoft's search engine, Bing, is blocked from crawling Reddit and offering links from the site in its search results. Reddit, which now demands payment from anyone crawling the site and using its data to train AI products, claims that Bing’s crawler is being used to power AI products. Microsoft, meanwhile, claims it has made it easy for any site to block its crawler that’s used for AI products while still allowing a crawler that is only used for search results, and argues that Reddit’s decision to block Bing is “impacting competition” in the search engine space

title: (Untitled)
description: After striking deals with Google and OpenAI, Reddit CEO Steve Huffman calls on Microsoft and others to pay if they want to continue scraping the site’s data

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta reaches $1.4 billion deal to settle claims brought by the Texas attorney general over allegations that the platform flouted state privacy laws when it collected millions of users’ biometric data without their consent through the use of its facial recognition software

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI rolls out its new voice mode to customers, after delaying the launch to do more safety testing on the tool. The company says the new features are capable of detecting emotions

title: (Untitled)
description: In the wake of staff layoffs, several of the most prominent alt-weekly newspapers in the U.S. are running search-engine-optimized listicles about porn performers, which appear to be AI-generated, alongside their editorial content

title: (Untitled)
description: Group of bipartisan lawmakers a letter asking Meta to delay shutting down CrowdTangle for six months, arguing that the company has a responsibility to be transparent about the content being shared on its platforms ahead of the 2024 election

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta blames hallucinations after its AI assistant incorrectly says that the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump didn’t happen

title: (Untitled)
description: Britain's antitrust watchdog scrutinizes Alphabet's partnership with Anthropic and its impact on competition

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta rolls out AI Studio, a set of tools that allows Instagram creators to make an AI persona that can answer questions and chat with their followers and fans on their behalf

title: (Untitled)
description: Social media platforms like Pinterest, TikTok and LinkedIn are trying a new tack to gain a bigger share of digital advertising—getting news outlets and other publishers to help them sell ads. Some publishing executives argue that a more partnership-oriented approach on the part of tech platforms would be beneficial to everybody, especially as social media firms have stopped referring people to publishers’ websites and instead are concentrating on getting people to spend more time on their own platforms

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk accuses Google of being biased against former President Trump, posting screenshots showing that the search engine's suggestions for “assassination attempt of” and “president donald” don't show Trump in the autocomplete predictions

title: (Untitled)
description: The rollout of OpenAI's SearchGPT and Microsoft's Bing generative search product force news companies to rethink possible deals with AI firms that need news content to answer real-time queries about current events

title: (Untitled)
description: 404 Media reports that hundreds of websites trying to block Anthropic from scraping their content are blocking the wrong bots, seemingly because they are copy/pasting outdated instructions to their robots.txt files, and because companies are constantly launching new AI crawler bots with different names that will only be blocked if website owners update their robots.txt. After the story is published, Anthropic tells 404 Media that CLAUDEBOT will respect block requests for its older two crawlers

title: (Untitled)
description: X suspends “White Dudes for Harris” for "violating [its] rules against evading suspension" shortly after a massive fundraising call where almost 200,000 people helped raise more than $4 million for the vice president and presumptive Democratic nominee

title: (Untitled)
description: Twitch's revamped app will open on a TikTok-like feed of content users might like instead of opening on the "Following" tab

title: (Untitled)
description: U.S. Justice Department says TikTok collected user information on sensitive topics, making it a national security threat that justifies a law to ban the platform in the U.S. if its China-based parent company ByteDance doesn't divest

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk reposts an edited campaign video for Vice President Kamala Harris that appears to have been digitally manipulated to change the spot’s voice-over in a deceptive manner, without the video's original disclaimer that it was a parody

title: (Untitled)
description: X automatically activates a setting that allows the company to train its Grok AI model on users' posts. Though the setting is enabled by default, users can switch it off and delete their conversation history with the AI

title: (Untitled)
description: Russia throttles access to YouTube as the Kremlin moves toward blocking one of the last U.S. social media sites still available in the country. Download speeds will be slowed by 70%

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI test new set of search feature called SearchGPT that will answer questions with more timely information and prominent links to sources, marking its most direct challenge yet to Google. OpenAI claims the new feature will "help users connect" with news sites rather than simply eat up all their traffic

title: (Untitled)
description: WhatsApp hits more than 100 million monthly active users in the U.S.

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok is fined £1.875 million in the U.K. for providing inaccurate data to Ofcom on its parental safety controls

title: (Untitled)
description: In response to Google's announcement that it would not be removing third-party cookies from Chrome, publishing executives tell Digiday they will be maintaining or increasing their test of cookieless targeting alternatives, including Google's Privacy Sandbox

title: (Untitled)
description: The New York Times uses a generative AI-powered ad tool called BrandMatch that uses LLMs to decode an advertiser's brief, uncover more specific audience segments and match that brief to the most relevant articles to run ads against

title: (Untitled)
description: iFixit CEO calls out Anthropic for hitting its servers nearly a million times in a single day, despite the repair database having terms of service provisions that state “reproducing, copying or distributing any Content, materials or design elements on the Site for any other purpose, including training a machine learning or AI model, is strictly prohibited without the express prior written permission of iFixit." After iFixit updates its robots.txt file to block ClaudeBot, the company stops accessing its content

title: (Untitled)
description: Study finds that training AI models on AI-generated text quickly leads to the models churning out nonsense. This phenomenon, termed model collapse, could halt the improvement of LLMs as they run out of human-derived training data and as increasing amounts of AI-generated text pervade the Internet

title: (Untitled)
description: Group of bipartisan lawmakers a letter asking Meta to delay shutting down CrowdTangle for six months, arguing that the company has a responsibility to be transparent about the content being shared on its platforms ahead of the 2024 election

title: (Untitled)
description: In an effort to curb surges in online scams and harms against minors, Malaysia and Singapore broaden their oversight of some of the most popular social media, messaging platforms and market sites

title: (Untitled)
description: Rep. Jerry Nadler pushes for the House Judiciary Committee to investigate whether Elon Musk’s X improperly prevented users from following an official presidential campaign account for Vice President Kamala Harris

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta introduces its newest open-source large language model, Llama 3.1, which is free for anyone to use and modify

title: (Untitled)
description: Due to the deal that gives Google the right to scrape Reddit for data to train its AI product, the former is now the only search engine that can surface results from the platform. This means one of the web's most valuable repositories of user-generated content is exclusive to the internet's already dominant search engine

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta staff internally debate Threads' policy against recommending political content on Threads. While people can freely share posts about politics on the platform, Meta only recommends those posts to people who have opted in to being suggested political content by the app’s algorithm

title: (Untitled)
description: Senators send letter to OpenAI demanding to turn over data about its efforts to build safe and secure artificial intelligence, following employee warnings that the company rushed through safety-testing of its latest AI model

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok’s Lite-Save Data version, aimed at users in poorer markets, not only leaves AI-generated content unlabeled, but also lacks other, similar safeguards

title: (Untitled)
description: Researchers estimate that only 16.7% of common tasks completed by news analysts, reporters and journalists can't be helped by LLMs. They think 43.3% of tasks will benefit from current LLMs, and the remaining 40% of tasks will benefit from LLMs when additional software is provided ot adapt to the task

title: (Untitled)
description: After years of testing planning and delays, Google scraps its plan to turn off third-party cookie tracking by default on its Chrome web browser. Now, Chrome will ask users to “make an informed choice that applies across their web browsing"

title: (Untitled)
description: European Union notifies Meta that is "pay or consent" model for Facebook and Instagram may violate consumer protection laws. The EU’s Consumer Protection Cooperation Network says the platform has until September 1st, 2024, to propose changes to its model, which it calls “misleading” and “confusing” for users, or face potential fines

title: (Untitled)
description: Condé Nast sends a cease-and-desist letter to Perplexity, demanding that it stop using content from Condé Nast publications, including The New Yorker, Vogue and Wired, in its search results. In the letter, the publisher accused Perplexity of plagiarizing its content

title: (Untitled)
description: With just months left until the 2024 U.S. presidential election and bombshell political news dropping at a steady clip, AI chatbots are distancing themselves from politics and breaking news or refusing to answer at all

title: (Untitled)
description: Researchers from the Data Provenance Initiative find that many of the most important web sources used for training AI models have restricted the use of their data over the past year. These data restrictions may pose to AI companies, which need a steady supply of high-quality data to keep their models up-to-date

title: (Untitled)
description: A study finds that Google's AI results appear to be showing up less frequently, though Google criticized the study's methodology

title: (Untitled)
description: Google partners with Team USA and NBCUniversal as their official Olympics Search partner

title: (Untitled)
description: As part of its effort to make AI "as broadly accessible as possible," OpenAI rolls out cut-price model called GPT-4o mini that it says will allow more companies and programs to tap into its artificial intelligence

title: (Untitled)
description: GB News Radio rolls out sports news bulletins that are written by generative AI and read out by the "virtual voice" of GB News present Tatiana Sanchez

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta will withhold its next multimodal AI model, as well as future ones, from customers in the European Union because of what the company describes as "the unpredictable nature of the European regulatory environment"

title: (Untitled)
description: Report by the Local Independent Online News Publishers finds that 95% of local online newsrooms produce newsletters, up from 81% in 2022

title: (Untitled)
description: The Wall Street Journal reports that, though Elon Musk wants people to get their news from his AI bot, Grok, following the Trump shooting the model posted incorrect information, amplified unverified claims and failed to identify sarcasm

title: (Untitled)
description: Proof News investigation finds that AI companies like Anthropic, Apple and Nvidia have used materials from thousands of YouTube videos to train their AI models, despite YouTube having rules against harvesting materials from the platform without permission

title: (Untitled)
description: Editorial union for Mashable, Lifehacker and PC Mag successfully bargains for protections against generative AI. The tentative contract explicitly prohibits any union member from being laid off or receiving a cut in their base salary as a result of the publications using generative AI

title: (Untitled)
description: Long-form video on YouTube is making a comeback, with the number of 20-plus minute videos uploaded to the platform each month increasing from 1.3 million in July 2022 to 8.5 million in June 2024

title: (Untitled)
description: Trump's attempted assassination triggers violent rhetoric and misinformation on platforms like X

title: (Untitled)
description: European Commission finds that X is in violation of several transparency and accountability measures required by Europe’s Digital Services Act, including those on advertising transparency, dark patterns and data access for research

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta rolls back restrictions it placed on former President Trump's Instagram and Facebook accounts, amid concerns that a smaller policy violation could result in his account being suspended or limited leading up to the 2024 election

title: (Untitled)
description: A year on from the launch of WhatsApp channels, The New York Times, CNN and New York Post have the most followers, finds the Press Gazette

title: (Untitled)
description: Amid antitrust scrutiny, Microsoft gives up its seat as an observer on the board of OpenAI while Apple opts not to take up a similar position

title: (Untitled)
description: Federal judge dismisses class action lawsuit alleging that Elon Musk's X Corp. owes ex-Twitter staffers $500 million in severance

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram takes down several interviews about the war between Hamas and Israel in Gaza posted by the left-wing independent media outlet Democracy Now and sends a notice saying that the publisher had shared symbols, praise, "or support of people and organizations we define as dangerous." A Meta spokesperson says the videos had been removed in error, but had been restored

title: (Untitled)
description: New app called Openvibe allows users to connect with friends and followers across Mastodon, Nostr, Bluesky and Threads in a combined timeline, and offers the ability to cross-post to multiple networks at once

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta's replacement for CrowdTangle, a social media monitoring tool that has been used to track misinformation, is less transparent and accessible, meaning journalists and researchers will have less ability to trace online information about elections

title: (Untitled)
description: 404 Media reports that a website called The Unofficial Apple Weblog (TUAW), which was shut down 10 years ago, has ended up in the hands of a company in Hong Kong that has stolen its former writers' identities and is running their old work through AI summarizers. After the 404 Media piece is published, TUAW changes the names of most of the "authors" on its site

title: (Untitled)
description: Spotify launches the ability to leave comments on podcasts, which will be private by default so creators will have to approve each comment they want to appear. Creators can choose to have comments available for their whole show or just specific episodes, and can also opt out of the feature entirely

title: (Untitled)
description: The Washington Post launches an AI-driven chatbot that answers user queries about climate using past Washington Post articles. In the future, the Post plans to expand the chatbot to other topics

title: (Untitled)
description: US government disrupts a Russian disinformation effort that used AI-powered bots to create fake social profiles on X to masquerade as Americans and push pro-Kremlin narratives

title: (Untitled)
description: Leaked code from the New York Times reveals that, despite its lawsuit against OpenAI, the publisher has developed a tool that would use AI company's tools to generate headlines for articles and "help apply the New York Times styleguide"

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI's lawyers ask the New York Times to bring forth documents proving which portions of the millions of articles in question in the publisher's lawsuit are "original to the Times". In response, the Times submitted a filing asserting that the request "serves no purpose other than harassment and retaliation" and is unprecedented and overly broad

title: (Untitled)
description: Ad spend and user growth on TikTok slow in the face of a potential ban threat

title: (Untitled)
description: In response to AI companies crawling and scraping websites for training data without permission, Cloudflare launches a free tool to prevent bots from scraping websites hosted on its platform

title: (Untitled)
description: Press Gazette reports that two local newspaper journalists who left their titles amid cost cuts on May are already making more money after launching their own newsletters on Substack

title: (Untitled)
description: Weeks after finalizing a deal with OpenAI, News Corp chief executive signals that the publisher is considering legal action against at least one generative artificial intelligence firm

title: (Untitled)
description: Despite having set a plan to go "net zero," Google's carbon emissions have grown 48% since 2019, including 13% in 2023. The platform cites the energy demands of AI for the past year's growth

title: (Untitled)
description: Threads reaches more than 175 million monthly active users on the eve of its one-year anniversary. However, the Washington Post reports that the platform is struggling to attract content creators due to its lack of distinct identity

title: (Untitled)
description: Though Google adjusted its policies to target AI spam earlier this year, plagiarizing content still comes up higher in search results months later—and SEO experts aren’t sure why

title: (Untitled)
description: Mastodon adds clickable author bylines on link posts that can direct users to the author's account on the fediverse, in an effort to allow journalists gain more exposure and increase their following

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta lifts its blanket ban on the word "shaheed" ("martyr" in English), following a review by its oversight board finds the platform's approach was overbroad

title: (Untitled)
description: U.S. Supreme Court remands judicial decisions involving challenges to Republican-backed laws in Florida and Texas that restrict the power of social media companies to remove or down-rank objectionable content. The justices said they did not have enough information to make a determination about whether the statute violate the right to free speech

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube rolls out policy change that allows people to request the takedown of AI-generated or other synthetic content that simulates their face or voice

title: (Untitled)
description: EU investigation finds Meta violated the Digital Markets Act in requiring Instagram and Facebook users to pay if they didn't want their personal data used to generate targeted ads. Meta could face fines of as much as 10 percent of its annual global revenue if the commission upholds the stance in its final decision

title: (Untitled)
description: Research finds that, despite Google's claims that its Gemini models can accomplish nearly impossible tasks thanks to their "long context," the models struggle to provide correct answers to questions about large datasets

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta considers blocking news content from Facebook in Australia if the government makes it pay licensing fees

title: (Untitled)
description: Two years after sending an open letter to YouTube with four solutions for reducing mis- and disinformation on the platforms, fact-checkers say there has been no meaningful change

title: (Untitled)
description: Although OpenAI's licensing agreements with publishers often include provisions that ChatGPT will produce attributed summaries of media companies' reporting, Nieman Lab finds that the chatbot is hallucinating URLs for at least 10 of OpenAI's news partners

title: (Untitled)
description: Time strikes multiyear content licensing deal and strategic partnership with OpenAI. The deal gives OpenAI access to Time's archives from the last 101 years to train its large language models and use for responses to user queries in its consumer-facing products, such as ChatGPT, and also gives the company access to Time's real-time content to help answer user queries as news unfolds. The deal also gives Time access to OpenAI's tech and tools to develop new products for its audience

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta starts testing user-created AI chatbots on Instagram

title: (Untitled)
description: The Center for Investigative Reporting, which produces Mother Jones and Reveal, sues OpenAI and its largest shareholder, Microsoft, in federal court for using the nonprofit news organizations' content without permission or offering compensation

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI’s ChatGPT and Microsoft’s Copilot regurgitate false information about the first 2024 U.S. presidential debate just hours after it first appeared online and was debunked. The false claim centers on CNN’s broadcast of the debate, which a conservative writer claimed without evidence was going to be on a “1-2 minute delay"

title: (Untitled)
description: California Senate passes bill that would fund $500 million in local journalism jobs a year by imposing a data-mining fee on Big Tech

title: (Untitled)
description: Perplexity cites as authoritative sources AI-generated blogs that contain inaccurate, out-of-date and sometimes contradictory information, according to a study conducted by AI content detection platform GPTZero

title: (Untitled)
description: Supreme Court clears the Biden administration to communicate freely with social media companies in a ruling that bolsters the government's ability to seek removal of what officials see as misinformation

title: (Untitled)
description: NBC will use an artificial clone of legendary broadcaster Al Michaels' voice to narrate its daily recaps of the summer Olympics for a feature called "Your Daily Olympic Recap" on Peacock

title: (Untitled)
description: Ahead of the first 2024 U.S. presidential debate, Instagram users notice that Instagram appeared to have changed its settings to automatically restrict political content every time they exited the app. A Meta spokesperson clarifies that users' choice in the apps political settings tool only 'mistakenly' appeared to have reset

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube made up nearly 10% of all viewership on connected and traditional TVs in the U.S, according to Nielsen

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta connects Threads more deeply to the fediverse by allowing users to like and see replies to their Threads posts that appear on other federated social media platforms

title: (Untitled)
description: In response to reports that AI startups like Perplexity were bypassing the Robots Exclusion Protocol, Reddit says it will block most automated bots from accessing its public data without a licensing deal

title: (Untitled)
description: Research by Google's DeepMind division into the most common malicious uses of AI finds that "deepfakes" that impersonate politicians and celebrities are far more prevalent than efforts to use AI to assist cyber attacks

title: (Untitled)
description: More than half of all social media users distrust information they see in their feeds related to the 2024 US election, finds a Tech Policy Press/YouGov poll. A significant number also believe that much of the political or election-related images or videos they're seeing is AI-generated

title: (Untitled)
description: Proof News finds that many AI voice cloning services don't require any proof of a human’s consent — just a simple click of an “I agree” button

title: (Untitled)
description: Reddit eyes search advertising amid a traffic surge from Google, as Reddit believes more users will want human answers to intent-based search queries as search engines lean further into AI summaries

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI delays the planned launch of voice and emotion-reading features for its ChatGPT chatbot because more time was needed for safety testing

title: (Untitled)
description: 404 Media reporter demonstrates how he was able to create a plagiarizing ChatGPT-powered news site for just $365.63

title: (Untitled)
description: New Corp Australia and TikTok held talks about a video content deal, which would have been one of the first such agreements for the platform, but failed to yield any formal agreements

title: (Untitled)
description: TechCrunch reports that none of the journalists they interviewed at The Atlantic or Vox Media had any inkling that their work would be handed over to OpenAI before their publishers' licensing deals with the company were announced

title: (Untitled)
description: X limits live streaming abilities to premium subscribers

title: (Untitled)
description: WIRED reports that Perplexity's chatbot plagiarized the publication's June 16 story about Perplexity's surreptitious scraping practices when prompted to summarize the article

title: (Untitled)
description: In the lead-up to the U.K. election, claims made by politicians are keeping fact-checkers busier than fake AI-generated content

title: (Untitled)
description: Publishers like The New York Times, The Guardian, Condé Nast and Forbes are among those who have attempted to block PerplexityBot and Perplexity AI from crawling their content and subsequently regurgitating it

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI buys Rockset, which builds tools to drive real-time search and data analytics

title: (Untitled)
description: Spotify allows non-hosted podcasters to upload videos to the platform. The platform now has more than 250,000 video podcasts, up from 100,000 in 2023

title: (Untitled)
description: New York governor Kathy Hochul signs two bills into law meant to mitigate negative impacts of social media on children. The first requires that parents be able to prevent their children from seeing posts suggested by a social network's algorithm, while the second will put additional limitations on the collection, use, sharing and selling of personal data of anyone under age 18

title: (Untitled)
description: Anthropic releases new AI model, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, that it calls its fasted and most capable yet

title: (Untitled)
description: WIRED analysis finds that Perplexity surreptitiously scraped online content by ignoring a widely accepted web standard known as the Robot Exclusion Protocol, despite claiming it won't do so. Furthermore, at times its chatbot summarizes stories inaccurately and with minimal attribution

title: (Untitled)
description: Ilya Sutskever, who left OpenAI in May after a dramatic falling out with company leadership over how to approach AI safety, launches a new company called Safe Superintelligence Inc.

title: (Untitled)
description: Leading AI chatbots regurgitate Russian misinformation, finds NewsGard report

title: (Untitled)
description: Former engineering manager at Snap launches Butterflies, a social network where humans and AI interact with each other through posts, comments and DMs

title: (Untitled)
description: Forbes threatens Perplexity with legal action, accusing the company of stealing text and images in a "willful infringement" of the publisher's copyright rights

title: (Untitled)
description: Canadian government dodges questions about whether the Online News Act applies to AI companies that are using news content in their chatbots

title: (Untitled)
description: The Reuters Institute's annual Digital News Report, which is based on surveys of nearly 100,000 people across 47 countries, finds that audiences are concerned about the use of AI in news production and misinformation. The report noted that respondents were more comfortable with behind-the-scenes uses of AI to make journalists' work more efficient

title: (Untitled)
description: In a move intended to prevent Perplexity users from going to other search engines, Perplexity now displays results for factual queries such as weather and time at a place, currency conversion, and answers to simple math queries directly through cards

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube introduces new experimental feature that will allow viewers to add "Notes" under videos to provide additional context and information, similar to the Community Notes feature on X

title: (Untitled)
description: U.S. Surgeon General Vivek H. Murthy writes an op-ed in the New York Times arguing in favor of a warning label on social media platforms "stating that social media is associated with significant mental health harms for adolescents." Mental health experts war that a label wouldn't solve platforms' child safety issues

title: (Untitled)
description: Google image search is serving users AI-generated images of celebrities and leading users to sites that host AI-generated nude celebrities made to look like children

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube reportedly experiments with server-side ad injection, which would inject ads directly into a video stream and render many ad blockers useless

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman tells shareholders that the company is considering changing its governance structure to a for-profit business that its nonprofit board does not control. One structure the company is considering is a for-profit benefit corporation, which is used by rivals such as Anthropic and xAI

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI expands the number of lobbyists on its global affairs team from three at the start of 2023 to 35. The company aims to build that up to 50 by the end of 2024

title: (Untitled)
description: Gen. Paul Nakasone, the former head of the National Security Agency, joins OpenAI's board of directors, where he will sit on the board "security and safety" subcommittee

title: (Untitled)
description: Amid growing outrage over how AI companies are using copyrighted materials, Danish media outlets demand that nonprofit web archive Common Crawl remove copies of their articles from past data sets and stop crawling their websites immediately. Common Crawl plans to comply with the request, as the organization is "not equipped" to fight media companies and publishers in court

title: (Untitled)
description: Yahoo debuts revamped version of its news app, powered by the underlying code of the well-received yet short-lived app Artifact, which employed algorithms to process user behavior and serve users highly personalized content based on which news stories they engaged with. The new Yahoo News app also features generative AI summaries of news articles

title: (Untitled)
description: Insider Union calls on Business Insider management to share details on the licensing deal it inked with OpenAI. In their letter, union members write, "We are... deeply worried that despite this partnership, OpenAI may be downplaying rather than elevating our works"

title: (Untitled)
description: Perplexity, which recently came under fire from Forbes for allegedly misusing its content, was already working on revenue-sharing deals with "high-quality" publishers. Semafor reports that the deals would be "a first-of-its kind revenue stream for media companies, providing a framework to earn recurring income"

title: (Untitled)
description: Publishers around the world hit by Facebook labeling "perfectly good news stories" as spam and deleting them

title: (Untitled)
description: The New York Times Guild urges management to reconsider cutting nine of the 16 positions from its art-product department, express concerns over what the union says amounts to an AI-based replacement

title: (Untitled)
description: Researchers identify two ways YouTube's in which the platform's algorithm could potentially redirect users away from news: 1) a "topical filter bubble," in which users watch entertainment videos and continue to get recommended more entertainment videos; and 2) "algorithmic redirection," in which the algorithm does the opposite and recommends you something different than what you're watching - for example, an entertainment video after you've finished watching a news video

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram tests ads that pop up from the bottom of users' friends stories, in a way that is similar to ads in many mobile games

title: (Untitled)
description: New survey from Pew Research finds that majority of Facebook, Instagram and TikTok users say keeping up with news is not a reason they use the sites, with X being the exception. However, people are still seeing news on all four platforms, especially through opinion- or humor-based content

title: (Untitled)
description: Major Danish newspapers and TV stations threaten to sue OpenAI unless the company compensates the country's press for allegedly using their content to train its models. If successful, this unusual tactic of attempting to force the company to negotiate with publishers as a collective might prove a model for other small countries

title: (Untitled)
description: AI-powered news platform Particle raises $10.9 million in Series A funding led by Lightspeed Venture Partners and announces partnership with Reuters to collaborate on new business models. The platform uses AI to summarize news from across a range of publishers

title: (Untitled)
description: LinkedIn tests AI product for Premium member that leverages Microsoft's AI technology to prompt users to chat with an AI assistant to learn more about a particular company or topic

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok test the ability for users to take or upload a photo to find similar products in TikTok Shop, challenging Google's dominance in image search

title: (Untitled)
description: Apple announces several new AI features an a partnership with OpenAI, which will integrate its tools into Apple's digital assistant Siri

title: (Untitled)
description: Apple announces that free call recording, transcriptions and Apple Intelligence-powered summaries are coming to the Phone app

title: (Untitled)
description: X makes "likes" mostly private so that, as the platform's owner Elon Musk says, "people can "like posts without getting attacked for doing so." Post authors can still see who likes their posts

title: (Untitled)
description: AI-powered search startup Perplexity appears to plagiarize journalists' work through its new feature, Perplexity Pages, which lets people curate content on a particular topic. Multiple posts that have been "curated" by its team on the platform are strikingly similar to original stories from multiple publications, but they do not mention the publications by name in the article text - the only attributions are small, easy-to-miss logos that link out to them

title: (Untitled)
description: Vietnamese authorities arrest one of the country's most prominent journalists, Truong Huy San, accusing him of "abusing democratic freedoms" by posting articles that "infringed on the interests of the state and the legitimate rights and interests of organizations and individuals." There were no details about the content of the posts

title: (Untitled)
description: Google agrees to pay Canadian news publishers $100 million annually, indexed to inflation, in order to be exempt from the Online News Act, which compels tech companies to enter into agreements with news publishers. The Canadian Journalism collective will be responsible for ensuring eligible news organizations get their share of the money

title: (Untitled)
description: Artist-run, anti-AI social platform Cara grows from 40,000 to 650,000 users within a week as artists flee Instagram to avoid having their art used for AI training data by Meta

title: (Untitled)
description: Many visual artists say they are leaving Instagram to prevent Meta from using their art to train AI models, and moving instead to Cara, a portfolio app for artists that bans AI posts and training

title: (Untitled)
description: Chamber of Progress, a tech industry coalition whose members include Amazon, Apple and Meta, launches a campaign to defend the legality of using copyrighted works to train AI systems, called "Generate and Create"

title: (Untitled)
description: Days after former employees said the company was being too reckless with its technology, OpenAI releases a research paper on a method for reverse engineering the workings of AI models

title: (Untitled)
description: More than 18 months after Elon Musk said he would demonetize hate posts, NBC News finds that X has been placing advertisements in the search results for at least 20 hashtags used to promote racist and antisemitic extremism, including #whitepower

title: (Untitled)
description: BNN Breaking, which published error-ridden, AI-generated content and had inked a licensing deal with Microsoft, goes dark

title: (Untitled)
description: Study finds that generative AI models tend to answer questions inconsistently, which reflects biases embedded in the data use to train the models. The research "shows significant variation in the values conveyed by model responses, depending on culture and language"

title: (Untitled)
description: Australia abandons legal battle to have graphic footage of a church stabbing in Sydney removed from X

title: (Untitled)
description: NewsBreak, which is the most downloaded news app in the US, has had at least 40 AI-related incidents since 2021, including publishing erroneous stories, creating local news stories under fictitious bylines, and lifting content from its competitors

title: (Untitled)
description: New research finds that in the days following the Jan. 6 insurrection, Twitter's decision to quickly deplatform 70,000 accounts trafficking in misinformation measurably reduced the overall circulation of misinformation on the platform. It did so by both reducing the amount of misinformation shared by the accounts themselves and by precipitating the voluntary exit from the platform of other users who regularly spread false claims

title: (Untitled)
description: Ad Tech Collective Action LLP, which represents UK publishers on an opt-out basis, brings a claim against Google alleging the platform abused its dominant position in the adtech market, causing huge losses to UK publishers worth as much as £13.6 billion

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube prohibits certain content showing how to remove safety devices from firearms

title: (Untitled)
description: An investigation by the Bureau of Investigative Journalism finds that Facebook failed to block thousands of political ads peddling false information, raising concerns Meta's ability to curb misinformation in the runup to major elections across Europe

title: (Untitled)
description: Digital Service Act forces tech companies to use aggressive tactics to limit the spread of disinformation surround the European elections. This unprecedented crackdown stands in stark contrast to the lack of social media laws in the U.S.

title: (Untitled)
description: WIRED reporter finds that Google downranked their article in favor of its AI Overview, which appeared nearly identical to their original content and did not explicitly cite the source

title: (Untitled)
description: LinkedIn launches beta test phase of its Wire Program, which enables media companies to sell 3- to 15-second-long pre-roll ads on their editorial video

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook implements changes to win over Gen Z, including refocusing its feed on discovery of content relevant to younger audiences, putting a greater emphasis on short-form video, and developing a professional mode to make the app more creator-friendly

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok says is has taken steps to stop a cyberattack targeting high-profile accounts, including one belonging to CNN

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta withheld information from federal regulators during their original reviews of the Instagram and WhatsApp acquisitions, the US Federal Trade Commission says in a court filing as part of a lawsuit seeking to break up the social networking giant

title: (Untitled)
description: Guardian Media Group chief executive Anna Bateson says the publisher “would do a deal” with an AI company “but only on the right terms and for the right value"

title: (Untitled)
description: U.K. broadcast news company ITN announces deal with tech company Open Origins seeking to safeguard its archive from the threat of AI. The deal will see every one of ITN's video clips of news footage validated and secured using blockchain technology, which will give its content proof of originality if it is exploited to make disinformation

title: (Untitled)
description: Google's reduces frequency with which AI Overviews appears in searches, from 84% to less than 15%

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram tests unskippable ads, which display a countdown timer that stops users from being able to browse through more content on the app until they view the ad

title: (Untitled)
description: An internal database obtained by 404 Media reveals that Google accidentally collected children's voice data, leaked the trips and home addresses of carpool users, and made YouTube recommendations based on users' deleted watch history, among thousands of other employee-reported privacy incidents collected over six years. The database shows how one of the most powerful companies in the world manages, and often mismanages, personal, sensitive data on people's lives.

title: (Untitled)
description: Former President Donald Trump joins TikTok, a platform he once tried to ban while in the White House

title: (Untitled)
description: Hoodline, founded in 2014 as a San Francisco-based hyper-local news outlet with a mission “to cover the news deserts that no one else is covering,” has been filling its site with AI-generated articles. Stories include fake bylines with names like Sarah Kim, Jake Rodriguez and Mitch M. Rosenthal alongside a tiny badge with the words "AI". Until recently, Hoodline further embellished the AI bylines with what appeared to be AI-generated headshots resembling real people and fake biographical information

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI shares that it has disrupted five covert influence operations with connections to Russia, China, Iran and Israel that sought to use their models in support of deceptive activity across the internet

title: (Untitled)
description: AI search platform Perplexity launches a new feature called Pages that will generate a customizable web page based on user prompts. The company says the purpose of the feature is to help educators, researchers and "hobbyists" share their knowledge

title: (Untitled)
description: The Union representing staff at The Atlantic says it is “alarmed” by the magazine’s new licensing agreement with OpenAI and demands that management make the terms of this deal public “immediately,” and “without spin"

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk agrees to testify in the SEC’s investigation into his 2022 purchase of Twitter, which is now known as X. The SEC is investigating potential violations of U.S. securities laws regarding Musk’s acquisition of the social media company as well as his statements and SEC filings about Twitter

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta begins to mine Instagram images and videos to train its artificial intelligence models on the platform's content. It is nearly impossible for users, especially those outside the European Union, to opt out

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok is working on a clone of its recommendation algorithm for its 170 million U.S. users that may result in a version that operates independently of its Chinese parent and be more palatable to American lawmakers who want to ban it

title: (Untitled)
description: Twitch terminates all members of its Safety Advisory Council, a resource of nine industry experts, streamers and moderators who consulted on trust and safety issues related to children on Twitch, nudity, banned users and more. Moving forward, the council will be primarily made up of individuals who serve as Twitch Ambassadors

title: (Untitled)
description: Damon Beres, a senior editor at The Atlantic, writes a piece describing publishers' deals with OpenAI as "devil's bargains"

title: (Untitled)
description: The Atlantic and Vox Media both ink multi-year partnerships with OpenAI, in which the company is able to license the publishers' archive content to train its AI models, and the publications can leverage the AI technology to power new journalism projects. Financial terms were not disclosed

title: (Untitled)
description: Ahead of the upcoming U.K. elections, the News Media Association asks for protection from the next government from generative AI companies taking local and national news publishers' content without payment

title: (Untitled)
description: Free ChatGPT users can now access custom GPTs, analyze charts, ask questions about photos, and other features added with GPT-4o in early May

title: (Untitled)
description: Leaked documents offer insight how Google keeps collects data that may be used in its closely guarded search ranking algorithm

title: (Untitled)
description: WAN-IFRA, the World Association of News Publishers, announces the launch of a broad-based accelerator program for over 100 news publishers in partnership with OpenAI. The Newsroom AI Catalyst is "an accelerator program designed to help newsrooms fast-track their AI adoption and implementation to bring efficiencies and create quality content"

title: (Untitled)
description: Mistral, the French AI startup backed by Microsoft, releases its first generative AI model for coding, dubbed Codestral. The model was trained on over 80 programming languages and designed to help developers write and interact with code

title: (Untitled)
description: The Washington Post adds AI-generated summaries highlighting three key "takeaways" for stories

title: (Untitled)
description: Sam Altman strikes a deal with Apple to use OpenAI’s conversational artificial intelligence in its products, which could be worth billions of dollars to the AI startup if it goes well

title: (Untitled)
description: The New York Times reports that a former Florida sheriff’s deputy wanted in the U.S. on felony charges, is using AI to operate a vast network of over 160 fake news websites, many mimicking legitimate U.S. and European outlets, spreading Kremlin-aligned propaganda—especially about the war in Ukraine and American politics. A month later, a NewsGuard audit finds that leading AI chatbots spread Russian disinformation narratives from state-affiliated sites masquerading as local news outlets

title: (Untitled)
description: Researchers find that most image-based disinformation is now AI-generated

title: (Untitled)
description: Financial Times chief executive John Ridding tells other news publishers they “have leverage and should insist on payment” from AI companies

title: (Untitled)
description: Jan Leike, a leading AI researcher who resigned from OpenAI earlier in May before publicly criticizing the company’s approach to AI safety, joins OpenAI rival Anthropic to lead a new “superalignment” team

title: (Untitled)
description: Canadian independent publishers warn Australian counterparts to brace for impact if Meta removes news from its platforms

title: (Untitled)
description: Pro-Russian disinformation groups are exploiting the “very, very lax” rules on Telegram and there’s not much EU authorities can do about it

title: (Untitled)
description: Tow Center: "Op-Ed: AI can't anthropomorphize its way to empathy"

title: (Untitled)
description: Amid a weak ad market and the threat of AI, media companies are shifting their strategies to depend more on readers' dollars and less on ads. The problem is that subscription media growth has slowed as publishers struggle to replace customers who canceled their Trump-era subscriptions

title: (Untitled)
description: Restructuring at TIkTok includes changes directly linked to creators and publishers, which could signal an increased effort to court media companies and bring more professional content to the app

title: (Untitled)
description: The Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism publishes the results of an online survey focused on understanding if and how people in Argentina, Denmark, France, Japan, the U.K., and the U.S. use generative AI, and what they think about its application in journalism and other areas of work and life

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI starts training its newest AI model that will fuel the ChatGPT chatbot, which it says will bring the company closer to achieving artificial general intelligence - the idea that refers to computers matching the power of human brains

title: (Untitled)
description: As OpenAI and other tech firms make advances, the media industry is split between pushing back and making deals

title: (Untitled)
description: The partisan publishers that thrived during the social media age — including high-flying right-wing outlets like Breitbart News and the Daily Caller — are being shut out of the new AI boom

title: (Untitled)
