description: Bluesky releases Starter Packs, which allow users to create custom feeds and recommend accounts to follow

title: (Untitled)
description: As TikTok's uncertainty in the U.S. continues, Snapchat, Meta, Pinterest, and Google are pitching to be part of advertisers' contingency planning

title: (Untitled)
description: The Verge and 404 Media build out new functions that would allow them to distribute posts on their sites and on federated platforms - like Threads, Mastodon and Bluesky - at the same time. Replies to those posts on those platforms become comments on their sites

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta and Google's parent company, Meta, hold discussions with major Hollywood studios about licensing content for use in their AI video generation software. Both companies are developing tools that can create realistic scenes from a text prompt and have offered tens of millions of dollars to partner with studios in some capacity

title: (Untitled)
description: Jessica Lessin, the founder of The Information, writes an op-ed in The Atlantic arguing that news organizations rushing to "absolve AI companies of theft" by signing licensing agreements are acting against their own interests

title: (Untitled)
description: U.K. Parliament passes the Digital Markets, Competition and Consumers Bill, paving the way for Australia-style payments to news publishers from tech giants

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok introduces new measures to limit the spread of videos from state-affiliated media accounts, including Russian and Chinese outlets, as the company deflects criticism that it could be used as a propaganda tool in a major election year

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok says it has taken down thousands of accounts that belonged to 15 covert influence operations in the first four months on 2024, including the second-largest such network detected from China. The campaign, which was aimed at people in the U.S., built their audience through accounts that impersonated celebrities or leading creators

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta considers charging users for a more advanced version of its artificial intelligence-powered assistant, Meta AI. Google, Microsoft, OpenAI and Anthropic each offer $20-per-month subscriptions for their chatbots

title: (Untitled)
description: Examples of Google's AI search going awry go viral, such as a recommendation to "add about 1/8 cup of non-toxic glue" to pizza sauce to help cheese stick on a pizza, based on a joke Reddit post from 2011

title: (Untitled)
description: Records show that OpenAI did not copy actress Scarlett Johansson's voice for its conversational AI system. While many hear an eerie resemblance between “Sky” and Johansson’s “Her” character, an actress was hired in June 2023 to create the Sky voice, months before Altman contacted Johansson, according to documents, recordings, casting directors and the actress’s agent

title: (Untitled)
description: The Washington Post's CEO and publisher, Will Lewis, tells staffers that the newspaper will be looking for ways to use AI in its reporting as it seeks to recoup some of the $77 million it lost last year

title: (Untitled)
description: News Corp, the parent company of publications like The Wall Street Journal and the New York Post, announces a multi-year partnership with OpenAI. The partnership permits the AI company to display content from News Corp mastheads in response to user questions and to "enhance its products, with the ultimate objective of providing people the ability to make informed choices based on reliable information and news sources"

title: (Untitled)
description: EU countries endorse landmark AI regulation deal that will regulate governments' use of biometric surveillance and as well as AI systems such as ChatGPT. The rules will go into effect in June 2024

title: (Untitled)
description: Teams within Meta discuss internally whether the company should strike new paid deals with news publishers to provide more and deeper access to news, photo, and video content

title: (Untitled)
description: After years of Meta steadily walking away from news on its platforms, its new AI chatbot now uses the work of those outlets for content. Meta AI scans news outlets and summarizes their latest stories and headlines for anyone who asks - including in Canada, where the company banned links to news sources on Facebook and Instagram to get around a law that could require it to pay publishers

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg creates a new product advisory council that will meet periodically with Meta's management team and offer guidance on the company's artificial intelligence and technology advancements

title: (Untitled)
description: The family of Michael Schumacher is awarded €200,000 compensation from the publishers of a German tabloid that published an AI-generated 'interview' with the former Formula 1 driver, who has not been see in public since suffering severe head injuries in a skiing accident in December 2013

title: (Untitled)
description: Tow Center: "Licensing deals, litigation raise raft of familiar questions in fraught world of platforms and publishers"

title: (Untitled)
description: The Wall Street Journal reports that News Corp's content licensing deal with OpenAI could be worth more than $250 million over five years, including compensation in the form of cash and credits for the use of OpenAI technology

title: (Untitled)
description: A fake, AI-generated video circulating on Facebook portrays Kenyan journalist Jeff Koinange endorsing a mobile gambling app

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok tells employees it plans significant layoffs in its operations and marketing teams

title: (Untitled)
description: Süddeutsche Zeitung, one of the largest daily newspapers in Germany, launches a new large language model to answer reader questions around the upcoming EU elections

title: (Untitled)
description: Google warns nonprofit newsrooms that passage of a new California bill would jeopardize the firm's future investments in the U.S. news industry

title: (Untitled)
description: Microsoft Edge will offer real-time, AI-powered video translation on sites like YouTube, LinkedIn and Coursera in the form of both dubbing and subtitles. So far, the feature supports the translation of Spanish into English as well as the translation of English to German, Hindi, Italian, Russian, and Spanish

title: (Untitled)
description: Google announces that ads will be available in its AI Overview feature and will soon appear at the top of Google search results

title: (Untitled)
description: A report shared with the Guardian reveals that Meta approved a series of AI-manipulated political advertisements during India's election that spread misinformation and incited religious violence

title: (Untitled)
description: Actress Scarlett Johansson threatens legal action against OpenAI, alleging it copied her voice for its conversational AI system after she refused to license it to the company. Johansson argues that OpenAI's "Sky" bears an uncanny resemblance to Johansson’s character in the 2013 movie “Her," in which she performed the voice of a super-intelligent AI assistant

title: (Untitled)
description: The Washington Post adds AI-generated audio to its three politics- and policy-focused newsletters to give readers the ability to listen to those emails

title: (Untitled)
description: Trump Media & Technology Group, the parent company of Truth Social, discloses that it lost $327.6 million on just $770,500 in revenue during the first quarter of 2024

title: (Untitled)
description: Amazon continues laying the groundwork for Prime to be to sports streaming what ESPN was to cable as it closes in on a deal to make it one of three partners with the NBA

title: (Untitled)
description: As Facebook and Google shift away from promoting news content, Apple News+ has come to represent a substantial stream of direct revenue for publishers like Condé Nast, Penske Media, Vox, Hearst, and Time

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI inks data and advertising deals with Reddit. The former requires OpenAI to commit to being a Reddit advertising partner, with Reddit also committing to bring “new AI-powered features to redditors and mods"

title: (Untitled)
description: The European Union opens an investigation into Facebook and Instagram for the platforms’ potentially addictive effects on children, echoing two similar probes opened into TikTok earlier this year

title: (Untitled)
description: Threads is testing pinned columns on the web, similar to the old TweetDeck

title: (Untitled)
description: Twitch streamers like leftist Hasan Piker have become some of the most influence political commentators for Gen-Z and young millennial audiences

title: (Untitled)
description: Gannett, the media company that owns hundreds of newspapers in the US, launches a new program that adds AI-generated "Key Points" at the top of journalists’ stories. The bullet point summaries are reviewed by a journalist before publication and aim to "enhance the reporting process and elevate the audience experience"

title: (Untitled)
description: Edward Lindeman, head of publisher operations at Tiktok in the UK, tells publishers that although there is “no magic formula” for getting big reach on the platform, the algorithm for its For You feed focuses on “the quality of the content”

title: (Untitled)
description: Anthropic hires Instagram co-founder Mike Krieger to be its new product chief, part of a broader push to bring its AI services to more users and businesses

title: (Untitled)
description: Tim Booker, one of the co-founders of Deadspin, tells WIRED “AI has no place” at the publication

title: (Untitled)
description: A bipartisan group of U.S. senators releases a "roadmap" for addressing AI, which includes priorities such as boosting funding for AI innovation, tackling nationwide standards for AI safety and fairness, using AI to strengthen national security, addressing job displacement caused by the technologies, tackling political "deepfakes" and non-consensual distribution of intimate images, and ensuring that opportunities to partake in AI innovation reach schools and companies

title: (Untitled)
description: An analysis of thousands of Indian WhatsApp messages by the Digital Witness Lab reveals how the country's ruling party uses the app to campaign free from public scrutiny

title: (Untitled)
description: Microsoft's pledge to remove more carbon that it emits is in peril as the company pushes to be the global leader in AI. Its president Brad Smith says the good AI can do for the world will outweigh its environmental impact

title: (Untitled)
description: Google debuts new agents, content creation tools and search features powered by generative AI

title: (Untitled)
description: Less than half of 3016 journalists surveyed say they are using generative AI tools like ChatGPT and Google’s Gemini in their work; just 5% say they are using these tools "often"

title: (Untitled)
description: Rumble, the YouTube alternative that is favored by conservatives, files a lawsuit against Google and its parent Alphabet, arguing that Google owes Rumble upwards of $1 billion in damages for lost ad revenue as a client, and for illegally leveraging its dominance in ad technology to hamper Rumble's ability to compete as an ad tech competitor

title: (Untitled)
description: Apple appears to have had no conversations with publishers about plans to roll out an aggressive ad-blocker and new text summarisation tool on its Safari browser. The changes could not only stop publishers from supporting their content with advertising on Apple devices, but they could mean Apple summarizes articles for readers without need for them to click on the page

title: (Untitled)
description: Threads starts its own fact-checking program, which allows fact-checkers to rate and mark false content on the platform, after piggybacking on Instagram and Facebook’s network for a few months

title: (Untitled)
description: Rumble files a new lawsuit against Google and its parent company Alphabet, seeking over $1 billion in damages for lost ad revenue and accusing Google of leveraging its ad tech dominance to hinder Rumble's competitive abilities. This second lawsuit follows a 2021 suit alleging Google's favoritism toward YouTube in search results and Android OS; both cases are underway in the Northern District of California, with the new complaint emphasizing Google's anticompetitive conduct and market manipulation in the ad tech sector

title: (Untitled)
description: Ilya Sutskever - the co-founder and chief scientist of OpenAI, who was also one of the board members who voted to remove co-founder Sam Altman as CEO in November - announces that he is leaving the AI company after almost a decade, stating that he is confident it will build artificial general intelligence (AGI) that is "both safe and beneficial"

title: (Untitled)
description: YouTube says it will comply with a court decision and block access inside Hong Kong to 32 video links deemed prohibited content, in what critics say is a blow to freedoms in the financial hub amid a security clampdown

title: (Untitled)
description: Google rolls out a retooled search engine called "AI Overviews" that will frequently favor responses crafted by artificial intelligence over website links, a shift promising to quicken the quest for information while also potentially disrupting the flow of money-making internet traffic

title: (Untitled)
description: Eight TikTok creators sue to stop the law that would ban the app unless its Chinese parent company divests it, arguing that the measure would strip them of their livelihoods and creative outlets

title: (Untitled)
description: The Oversight Board overturns Meta’s decision to take down a documentary video posted by Voice of America Urdu that revealed the identities of child victims of sexual abuse and murder from Pakistan in the 1990s. Although the board finds the post did violate the Child Sexual Exploitation, Abuse and Nudity Community Standard, the majority find that a newsworthiness allowance should have been applied in this case

title: (Untitled)
description: Google rolls out a new search filter named "Web" that removes images, videos, or other forms of search results and shows only text-based links

title: (Untitled)
description: A local union raises concerns over Gannett's new contract, which includes a clause that states that AI "may be used to generate news content"

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI announces its flagship model GPT-4o, which provides ChatGPT users with faster, real-time voice and video interaction capabilities

title: (Untitled)
description: Publishers worry about how Google's "Search Generative Experience," which directly answers queries with complex, multi-paragraph replies that push links to other websites further down the page, could affect their site traffic

title: (Untitled)
description: The Australian government launches a parliamentary committee to investigate the "influence and impacts of social media on Australian society." The inquiry will examine issues including the mental health impact of social media algorithms and the spread of illegal content online

title: (Untitled)
description: A leaked deck reveals how OpenAI has been pitching partnership opportunities to new publishers through an initiative called the Preferred Publishers Program

title: (Untitled)
description: The New York Times publishes its principles for using generative AI in the newsroom, which underscores that these tools should be used transparently and ethically in service of the publication's mission, with human guidance and review

title: (Untitled)
description: Data from publisher analytics firm Chartbeat and digital intelligence platform Similarweb shows the referrals to news sites from Facebook have fallen 50% in one year

title: (Untitled)
description: Reddit releases new policies governing data posted on its platform, including a ban on using Reddit posts or comments that have been deleted, as it seeks to increase revenue through licensing agreements with AI developers and other companies

title: (Untitled)
description: The New York Times discloses that it has spent $1 million so far in its OpenAI lawsuit

title: (Untitled)
description: Writers and publishers in Singapore are resisting their government's request to use their works to train a multilingual large language model

title: (Untitled)
description: Threads users will soon be able to view counts for posts

title: (Untitled)
description: Nancy Lane, the CEO of the Local Media Association and the Local Media Foundation writes a piece arguing that the loss of the Google News Initiative would be disastrous for the local news industry. She writes, "If GNI dissolves, a lot of the innovation will go with it. A lot of people will lose their jobs. Labs, accelerators, training, conferences and more will go away"

title: (Untitled)
description: Anthropic says its decision to partner with both Google and Amazon ensure it can maintain more "independence" than if it were reliant on one large tech firm, as is the case with rival OpenAI

title: (Untitled)
description: Two winners of the 2024 Pulitzer Prize disclose using AI to produce their stories. Local reporting prize winner “Missing in Chicago,” from City Bureau and Invisible Institute, trained a custom machine learning tool to comb through thousands of police misconduct files, and the New York Times visual investigations desk trained a model to identify 2,000-pound bomb craters in areas marked as safe for civilians in Gaza

title: (Untitled)
description: AdVon Commerce, the company behind the AI-generated reviews published in Sports Illustrated and USA Today, engages in "site reputation abuse" that blurs the line between journalism and advertising, reports Futurism

title: (Untitled)
description: A new report from Northwestern University’s Medill Local News Initiative seeks to identify the potential perils and benefits of generative AI on local news business models and journalism itself

title: (Untitled)
description: An investigation by The Washington Post of Donald Trump's posts on Truth Social finds that, despite its relatively small user base, the platform directly connects him to influencers with enormous networks and audiences outside the platform

title: (Untitled)
description: Despite its promises to create a better, faster web for media companies with its AMP standard, Google ultimately ruined the trust publishers had in the internet giant by making it harder for them to use alternative ad tools that might have generated more money for them

title: (Untitled)
description: Informa, a UK publishing and exhibitions company, strikes a deal with Microsoft worth more than $10 million in its first year to give access to its data and improve the technology company's artificial intelligence systems

title: (Untitled)
description: Jack Dorsey, the co-founder of Twitter, leaves the board of the decentralized platform Bluesky, and urges users to stay on Elon Musk's X

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok sues the U.S. government to stop a potential ban, arguing that it would violate the First Amendment by effectively removing an app that millions of Americans use to share their views and communicate freely

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI is developing a feature for ChatGPT that can search the web and cite sources in its results, potentially competing head on with Google and the AI search startup Perplexity

title: (Untitled)
description: OpenAI says it is developing a tool called Media Manager that will allow creators and content owners to identify their works to OpenAI and specify how they want those works to be included or excluded from AI research and training. The company hopes to have the tool in place by 2025

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta tests new tools that will let advertisers create marketing material, including images and messaging, using generative AI prompts

title: (Untitled)
description: Data from Sistrix shows that most leading publishers have experienced significant declines in Google SEO visibility between Sept. 4, 2023 and April 22, 2024

title: (Untitled)
description: Substack announces Substack Creator Studio, a fellowship for content creators to turn their TikTok channels into Substack shows and communities. In addition to consulting and product support, the 10 winners will get technical support during the launch process, a robust marketing commitment, and a program-culminating event to celebrate their work

title: (Untitled)
description: Dotdash Meredith, one of the largest digital publishers in the U.S., inks a deal with OpenAI to license its content to train the company's algorithms as well as work together on new AI products and provide real-time, authoritative information to ChatGPT users

title: (Untitled)
description: Imagine, Meta's new AI image generator, displays a predisposition to generating Indian men wearing a turban, among other biases

title: (Untitled)
description: In the face of the Financial Times' recent deal with OpenAI, FT columnist and editor Rana Foroohar writes that she "worr[ies] that we are about to see a repeat of what happened in the mid- to late-1990s, when media companies bought into Silicon Valley’s line that 'information wants to be free' and didn't take a hard line on protecting the copyright and value of their content."

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook hosts a thriving black market for fake and stolen accounts that can run political ads in India, raising concerns that they could be used for election interference in the country, Tech Transparency Project finds

title: (Untitled)
description: Several lawmakers including Mitt Romney admit that they have linked the possible ban of TikTok to their concerns about content on the app that they think is too sympathetic to Palestinians under siege in Gaza

title: (Untitled)
description: Twitch streamers become a go-to news sources for coverage of campus protests of the war in Gaza, with round-the-clock coverage of major protest developments, negotiations between students and administrators, and police crackdowns

title: (Untitled)
description: A group of Meta employees publishes open letter calling out what they claim to be internal and external censorship by the company of any show of support for Palestinians amid Israel's war with Hamas

title: (Untitled)
description: News outlets struggle to present a unified front in their fight for copyright protection - some are opting to partner with AI firms while others are suing them - which could weaken their leverage in negotiations with Big Tech to license their content

title: (Untitled)
description: As platforms move away from producing original content, they are cracking down on spammy aggregators in order to help creators who create compelling posts and videos a better shot of breaking through

title: (Untitled)
description: An analysis of 37 AI guidelines in 17 countries around the world finds that a lot of the guidelines were made from the top down, without any consultation of journalists

title: (Untitled)
description: Two months after sounding the alarm about independent publishers being demoted on Google to give way to big media sites, ad-free independent review site HouseFresh has virtually disappeared from Google Search results

title: (Untitled)
description: X is launching a dedicated TV app for videos uploaded to the social network soon. The platform's CEO Linda Yaccarino announced that the new app, which has an interface that looks quite similar to YouTube, will bring “real-time, engaging content to your smart TVs"

title: (Untitled)
description: Universal Music Group, which pulled its music from TikTok in February, inks a new deal with the platform that involves "ensur[ing] AI development across the music industry will protect human artistry and the economics that flow to those artists and songwriters." Tiktok commits to working to remove unauthorized AI-generated music from the platforms, as well as tools to improve artist and songwriter attribution

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok pushes to compete for marketers' TV budgets with its new TikTok Pulse product, which lets brands target the top 4% of trending videos and offers placements against videos from premium publishers

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta reveals AI-powered tool for ad buyers that recommends creators to brands on its searchable Creator Marketplace

title: (Untitled)
description: As the possibility of a TikTok ban looms, executives at Bustle Digital Group, Gallery Media Group and The Washington Post tell Digiday they don't have plans to change their audience development strategies on social media or abandon the platform. This confidence comes down to having a strong production and distribution strategy for short-form vertical video on other social platforms, thanks in large part to TikTok

title: (Untitled)
description: Snapchat announces new products that allow advertisers to integrate artificial Lenses into its ad products

title: (Untitled)
description: Academic Ethan Zuckerman sues Meta to win protections for add-ons that would help researchers study the platform and give users more control over their feeds

title: (Untitled)
description: Substack launches ability for writers to paywell their entire Chat or specific threads to paid or founding members only

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram updates its recommendation system to focus on original content and increase distribution for smaller accounts. Aggregator accounts that share reposted content are going to be removed from the platform's recommendations

title: (Untitled)
description: Facebook's recommendation engine is injecting users' feeds with AI-generated images of starving, drowning, amputated, bruised and otherwise suffering and mutilated children, 404 Media reports

title: (Untitled)
description: European Commission opens formal proceedings into whether Meta breached the Digital Services Act. The suspected infringements include the company's policies and practices relating to deceptive advertising and political content on its services, as well as the non-availability of an effective third-party real-time civic discourse and election-monitoring tool ahead of the elections to the European Parliament given Meta's deprecation of CrowdTangle

title: (Untitled)
description: Google agrees to pay Wall Street Journal owner News Corp between $5 million and $6 million annually to fund its development of new artificial intelligence-related content and products. The arrangement follows Google's recent termination of another content partnership with The Journal, which resulted in layoffs at the publication

title: (Untitled)
description: Newsletter startup beehiiv raises $33 million to expand its business as well as the technical capabilities of its platform

title: (Untitled)
description: Eight prominent U.S. newspapers owned by investment giant Alden Global Capital - the New York Daily News, Chicago Tribune, Orlando Sentinel, South Florida Sun Sentinel, San Jose Mercury News, Denver Post, Orange County Register and St. Paul Pioneer Press - sue OpenAI and Microsoft for copyright infringement, in a complaint filed in the Southern District of New York

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta has its biggest lobbying quarter ever in the first few months of 2024, spending a record $7.6 million engaging with the US government, according to its public lobbying filing

title: (Untitled)
description: European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen hints that banning TikTok in the European Union is an option, during a debate in Maastricht

title: (Untitled)
description: The Financial Times signs a content licensing deal with OpenAI, which will allow ChatGPT to pull information in real time from the FT's published stories, including content behind the publication’s standard and premium paywalls, when answering user prompts. Details taken from those stories will appear in ChatGPT as a summary or quote, with a link to the specific article being cited

title: (Untitled)
description: The National Institute of Standards and Technology announces the launch of NIST GenAI, a new program spearheaded by NIST to assess generative AI technologies including text- and image-generating AI

title: (Untitled)
description: As Google deprecates third-party cookies, publishers must consider how signal loss will affect their businesses and ensure they are future-proofing their operations

title: (Untitled)
description: Multiple House aides familiar with the TikTok ban bill confirm that it’s their understanding that CapCut, the ByteDance editing app that made it easy to edit short-form video, would be subject to the same divest-or-ban requirement as TikTok. Tech columnist Taylor Lorenz writes that this could end short-form video as we've come to know it as many content creators rely on the app to edit their videos

title: (Untitled)
description: Fact-checkers are using generative AI, but it's proving less useful in small languages and outside the West, finds the Reuters Institute

title: (Untitled)
description: WhatsApp tells the Delhi High Court that the messaging platform will effectively shut down in India if it forced to break message encryption

title: (Untitled)
description: Amazon and YouTube vie for NBA streaming rights

title: (Untitled)
description: Discord bans a mass of accounts that were part of a service that scraped and sold user data, including messages posted across servers and what voice channels they joined, following 404 Media's reporting on the matter

title: (Untitled)
description: Despite the threat posed to Google’s search dominance by new generative AI competitors, revenue from the channel soars in the first quarter of 2024. Google brought in more than $46 billion in search revenue, a 14% year-over-year increase and the most the company’s search revenue has grown in two years

title: (Untitled)
description: In an analysis of 4,500 headline requests from ChatGPT and Bard collected across ten countries, researchers at the Reuters Institute find in most cases, generative AI bots respond with some version of ‘I am unable to’ when asked for the latest news from a specific outlet. Bard very rarely produced news-like output, and ChatGPT only did so less than half the time

title: (Untitled)
description: Data shows that while U.K. ad market grew 6.1% in 2023, tech platforms took all of the growth. Google's parent company Alphabet emerged as the biggest winner

title: (Untitled)
description: ByteDance internally explores scenarios for selling a majority stake in TikTok's U.S. business, without the algorithm that recommends videos to TikTok users

title: (Untitled)
description: TikTok halts controversial rewards program on its Lite app before EU watchdogs carried out their threat to temporarily ban the feature over fears it could be addictive for children

title: (Untitled)
description: U.S. president Joe Biden signs a foreign aid package that includes a bill that would ban TikTok if China-based parent company ByteDance fails to divest the app within a year

title: (Untitled)
description: 404 Media reports on a trend wherein services will "poison" Reddit threads with AI-generated posts designed to promote products

title: (Untitled)
description: Researchers from the Stanford Internet Observatory find that AI-generated images have become the latest form of social media spam

title: (Untitled)
description: Gab introduces email newsletter ads, offering businesses aligned with their values a platform to reach an audience seeking alternatives to mainstream services

title: (Untitled)
description: The U.K.’s Competition and Markets Authority launches preliminary inquiries into whether the close-knit tie-ups and hiring practices involving Microsoft, Amazon and a trio of AI startups falls within the scope of its merger rules — and whether the arrangements could impact competition in the U.K. market

title: (Untitled)
description: Publishers change up their newsletter strategies to engage audiences as a wave of generative AI advancements increase the need for original content and referral traffic declines push publishers to find alternative ways to reach readers

title: (Untitled)
description: Perplexity AI, a startup using artificial intelligence to build a search engine to compete with Alphabet Inc.’s Google, raises about $63 million in a new funding round that values the company at more than $1 billion

title: (Untitled)
description: Researchers find that deepfake detection improves when using algorithms that are more aware of demographic diversity

title: (Untitled)
description: Tow Center: "Op-Ed: AI’s Most Pressing Ethics Problem"

title: (Untitled)
description: Threads is now consistently surpassing X in daily US users, data shows

title: (Untitled)
description: Spotify reports record quarterly profit after a year marked by deep layoff and activist attention

title: (Untitled)
description: X is launching a dedicated TV app for videos uploaded to the social network soon. The platform's CEO Linda Yaccarino announced that the new app, which has an interface that looks quite similar to YouTube, will bring “real-time, engaging content to your smart TVs"

title: (Untitled)
description: Instagram invites creators to join a challenge focused on posting content related to "positivity" for a chance to win up to $500

title: (Untitled)
description: A new audit of social media platforms' ad libraries finds significant gaps that hinder basic transparency efforts ahead of a historic global election year

title: (Untitled)
description: The Washington Post is developing an AI-powered answer tool based on the publication's previous coverage, in partnership with Virginia Tech’s Sanghani Center for Artificial and Data Analytics

title: (Untitled)
description: U.S. House of Representatives approves legislation that would ban TikTok nationwide unless its Chinese owners sell the app

title: (Untitled)
description: China orders Apple to remove some of the world's most popular chat messaging apps, including WhatsApp and Threads, from its app store in the country, the latest example of censorship demands on the company

title: (Untitled)
description: Research by the Media Ecosystem Observatory finds that the end of news availability on Facebook has resulted in a significant decrease in engagement for Canadian news outlets, but has not substantially changed the behavior of Canadian Facebook users

title: (Untitled)
description: Experts warn that the broad use of Meta's new AI chatbot may amplify problems that have long plagued the company's social networks, including harmful misinformation, hate speech and extremist content

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta incorporates new versions of its AI-powered smart assistant software across its apps - including Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger and Facebook - in more than a dozen countries. The Meta AI assistant, which is built with LLaMA 3, appears inside the news feed, in search bars and in chats with friends, and users can ask it for help in completing tasks and getting information

title: (Untitled)
description: 404 Media reports that an online service is scraping Discord servers en masse, archiving and tracking users’ messages and activity across servers including what voice channels they join, and then selling access to that data for as little as $5. Called Spy Pet, the service’s creator says it scrapes more than ten thousand Discord servers, and besides selling access to anyone with cryptocurrency, is also offering the data for training AI models or to assist law enforcement agencies, according to its website

title: (Untitled)
description: Newsweek joins competitors like Business Insider in taking a relatively bullish view on AI, encouraging staff writers and editors to experiment with the technology to boost speed and efficiency

title: (Untitled)
description: Weeks ahead of Europe's major election, the well-known Russian disinformation campaign Doppelganger is growing on Facebook by pushing pro-Kremlin narratives with ads purchased through fake accounts

title: (Untitled)
description: Snap announces it plans to add watermarks to AI-generated images image exported from the app or saved to the camera roll

title: (Untitled)
description: EU privacy watchdog the European Data Protection Board says Meta and other large online platforms should give users an option to use their services for free without targeted advertising

title: (Untitled)
description: Pakistan's interior ministry says it had blocked access to X around the time of the country's February election on national security concerns, confirming a long-suspected shutdown

title: (Untitled)
description: Truth Social announces the development of a TV streaming platform, with plans to integrate streaming content into its app and website, and eventually release a TV app, though no timeframe is provided. Despite this expansion, shares of Trump Media & Technology Group have significantly declined since their Wall Street debut, reducing former President Trump's net worth by over $2.4 billion

title: (Untitled)
description: Rest of World launches 2024 AI Elections Tracker, which tracks the most noteworthy incidents of AI-generated election content globally

title: (Untitled)
description: The mainstreaming of AI image generators has brought with it an influx of artificial child sexual abuse imagery, according to a new report from the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children

title: (Untitled)
description: Dozens of Alden Global Capital-owned newspapers run editorials arguing that Google's threat to cut off news in California "is a bully tactic"

title: (Untitled)
description: The News/Media Alliance, which represents more than 2,000 news publishers, sends letters to federal agencies urging them to launch an investigation into Google after the platform began removing links to California-based news outlets

title: (Untitled)
description: Several Google employees are arrested at the company’s offices in New York City and Sunnyvale, California, after staging sit-ins to protest the platform's work with the Israeli government, escalating the conflict inside tech companies over the war in Gaza and whether U.S. companies should sell their technology to Israel

title: (Untitled)
description: A study by German researchers finds that Google search has been taken over by low-quality SEO spam

title: (Untitled)
description: Some ex-TikTok employees say the social media platform worked closely with its China-based parent despite claims of independence

title: (Untitled)
description: Lawyers representing Elon Musk's X told Brazil's Supreme Court that the social media platform will reverse course and comply with every ruling issued by the court or Brazil's top electoral court

title: (Untitled)
description: Meta plans to "temporarily" shutter Threads in Turkey in response to an interim injunction imposed by the Turkish competition authority over the way Meta shares data between Threads and Instagram

title: (Untitled)
description: The Kansas Reflector reports that Facebook removed all post linking to the publisher's website. Facebook later restores the Reflector's ability to share links to its website and Meta spokesman Andy Stone wrote that it was "an error that had nothing to do with the Reflector's recent criticism of Meta."

title: (Untitled)
description: Elon Musk plans to charge new X users a small fee to enable posting on the social network and to curb the bot problem

title: (Untitled)
description: The blocking of news links has led to profound and disturbing changes in the way Canadian Facebook users engage with information about politics, researchers find. They worry the lack of news on the platform and increased user engagement with opinion and non-verified content has the potential to undermine political discourse

title: (Untitled)
description: Chatbots produced by Google, Microsoft and OpenAI shared false information about the European election two months before hundreds of millions head to cast their ballot, according to research by Democracy Reporting International, a Berlin-based NGO

title: (Untitled)
description: Google temporarily blocks links from local news outlets in California from appearing in search results in response to the advancement of a bill that would require tech companies to pay publications for links that platforms share

title: (Untitled)
description: Hundreds of political and news content creators, along with activists, meme account administrators and journalists, sign an open letter to Meta asking the company to reverse its decision to limit the reach of accounts posting “political content” on Threads and Instagram

title: (Untitled)
description: A new study from The Associated Press finds that generative artificial intelligence is already reshaping newsroom roles and workflow. Nearly 70% of newsroom staffers from a variety of backgrounds and organizations surveyed say they're using the technology for crafting social media posts, newsletters and headlines; translation and transcribing interviews; and story drafts, among other uses. One-fifth say they’d used generative AI for multimedia, including social graphics and videos

title: (Untitled)
description: A board member of Trump Media & Technology Group, which owns Truth Social, has been accused of hacking one of the executives who helped bring the firm public as part of a corporate coup attempt to oust the CEO of Digital World Acquisition Corp, with which Trump Media had merged

title: (Untitled)

description: Rumble acquires podcasting startup Callin in an all-stock deal worth up to 2.5 million shares. This acquisition aims to strengthen Rumble's content business, with Callin forming the foundation of Rumble Studios, a comprehensive content creation platform. As part of the deal, David Sacks joins Rumble’s board of directors, reflecting Rumble's strategy to enhance its business sustainability and expand its technological capabilities

description: Paul Deegan, the president and chief executive of Canada's news industry trade body, told publishers in other countries not to be “intimidated” by threats from Google and Facebook as more jurisdictions pursue legislation to force the duopoly to pay for news

CEO Chris Pavlovski highlights this as a milestone in Rumble's vision to offer creators the best economic toolkit. A public beta release is anticipated soon and full release is planned by the end of the year

title: (Untitled)

title: (Untitled)
description: Since Musk took ownership of Twitter, the platform has received 971 government demands, and fully complied with 808 of them. Before Musk, Twitter's full compliance rate hovered around 50%; since the takeover, it is over 80%

title: (Untitled)
description: According to an investigation by the Wall Street Journal, exiled Chinese tycoon Guo Wengui, indicted for billion-dollar fraud, controls the conservative social media platform Gettr, using it to promote cryptocurrencies and propaganda. Guo and his money manager, William Je, influenced company decisions while Jason Miller served as the public face. Gettr also faces scrutiny for altering information requested by law enforcement and making substantial payments to right-wing figures

title: (Untitled)

Starboard's purchase comes months after Kanye West's agreement to buy the platform collapsed

description: An investigation by The Guardian reveals that top executives at Truth Social became concerned about $8 million in emergency loans accepted from opaque entities. These loans, arranged hastily and coming from sources with potential Russian connections, led to federal prosecutors investigating Trump Media for possible money laundering. Despite concerns, the money was not returned as it constituted a significant portion of the company's available funds and was crucial for financial stability

description: The United Nations reports that Myanmar's military junta is using Telegram to perpetrate terror and suppress dissent, particularly targeting women activists through online harassment and doxxing. Despite Telegram's recent actions in blocking some pro-military accounts, UN experts emphasize the urgent need for comprehensive changes in content moderation to prevent further human rights abuses, calling on tech companies to allocate resources to protect users, especially women, and monitor content in local languages

description: The influx of social media platforms and video formats entering the scene have forced publishers to weigh how to treat those readers: build an audience that stays on the platform — or funnel them back to their owned and operated properties, according to conversations with heads of audience development and social at Bustle Digital Group, Vice Media Group and The Washington Post

title: (Untitled)

description: Venezuela’s government spreads pro-government propaganda using AI-generated news segments with fake news anchors that promote an improved image of the country’s struggling economy. These avatars, created using the AI software Synthesia, have been featured on YouTube, TikTok, and state television

description: Faced with economic headwinds and political and legal pressure, [social media giants like Google, Meta and Twitter] have shown signs that fighting false information online is no longer as high a priority, raising fears among experts who track the issue that it will further erode trust online

Additionally, surveys show that 20% of American adults have heard of Rumble, and 2% use it regularly. Of these users, 76% identify as Republican

Rumble, which hosts RT's content, has received significant investments and promotes itself as a bastion of free speech, despite controversy over its hosting of Russian propaganda amidst the ongoing Ukraine conflict

description: BitChute continues to host videos of the 2019 Christchurch terror attack weeks after joining Tech Against Terrorism, an anti-terrorism organization launched by the UN. The Christchurch attack video has been viewed over 150,000 times on BitChute, and while some flagged content has been removed, critics argue that it remains a haven for hate speech and dangerous disinformation

description: U.S. Representatives Stephen F. Lynch and Carolyn B. Maloney send letters to various social media companies, including Meta, Twitter, and Gab, seeking information on their response to a surge in online threats against law enforcement officers following the FBI's search at former President Trump’s Mar-a-Lago Club. The letters express concerns over violent rhetoric on social media platforms, triggered by statements from former President Trump and Republican members of Congress, which have led to real threats against law enforcement, prompting a call for immediate action to address the issue

description: Gettr laid off its entire IT and security teams on December 28th, raising concerns about the site's security vulnerabilities, according to three former employees. description: A year after the storming of the US capitol, New America releases the first report in its ongoing analysis of Parler posts. The report provides early insights into the potential for election-related violence leading up to the Capitol attack. Congress is currently investigating how platforms like Parler contribute to polarization and extremism, given their lax content moderation and susceptibility to manipulation. These findings highlight the need for further examination of the impact of alternative social media platforms on national security

description: Upon Donald Trump announcing the launch of Truth Social, pranksters quickly exploited an unreleased test version, creating fake accounts to troll public officials, including Trump. These hackers demonstrate the significant security and design issues facing the site. In addition, journalists note that the site's terms of service contain provisions that appear to be at odds with its "Free Speech" branding, such as banning the "excessive use of capital letters" and content that would "disparage, tarnish, or otherwise harm... the Site"

description: According to a report from the Anti Defamation League, the presence of fringe content and misinformation on Twitter persists, despite the platform's efforts to curb hate speech and disinformation. Analysis by ADL's Center on Extremism reveals that Gab, known for hosting extremists and spreading misinformation, maintains a significant influence on Twitter, with over 112,000 tweets containing Gab links shared by more than 32,700 users, potentially reaching 254+ million views. These links often disseminate COVID-19 misinformation and political conspiracy theories, illustrating Twitter's ongoing struggle to contain harmful content originating from external platforms

description: New Republic reports that resistance against COVID-19 pandemic interventions like vaccine mandates and lockdown measures find support on Gab. Andrew Torba, CEO of Gab, champions an anti-establishment narrative, aiming to position Gab within the alt-tech movement challenging Big Tech monopolies, despite criticisms of Gab's role in promoting bigotry and hate speech. As New Republic writes, Gab is critiqued for becoming a "hotbed of bigotry and racial hatred, and part of a growing tech empire that seems to have few principles beyond preserving a certain vision of free speech at all costs"

description: The Stanford Internet Observatory publishes a new report on Gettr. Key findings show that, despite claims of rapid growth, Gettr's user count seems exaggerated, with the platform having only 1.5 million users by early August, many of whom are spam accounts or largely inactive. In addition, the platform lacks effective content moderation, allowing pornographic content while restricting relatively mild language, and fails to implement standard measures to prevent the spread of illegal imagery. Gab's CEO, Jason Miller, disputes all of these findings

description: Hackers scraped email addresses and other data from over 90,000 GETTR users and posted it on a hacking forum. The leaked data includes email addresses, usernames, status, and location, which was verified by Motherboard. The incident is considered a data breach due to poor API implementations. Despite GETTR CEO Jason Miller's claims that no new intrusion occurred and that the issue was quickly rectified, the platform has faced multiple security issues since its launch, including the defacement of prominent accounts on the first day

description: The Guardian reveals that Facebook has allowed major abuses of its platform in poor, small and non-western countries by world leaders in order to prioritize addressing abuses that attract media attention or affect the U.S. and other wealthy countries. The platform frequently allows world leaders and politicians to deceive the public or harass opponents, despite being alerted to evidence of the wrongdoing, says The Guardian

description: Jason Miller, a senior adviser to former President Donald Trump, launches the social media site GETTR. While the site quickly registers over 500,000 users, it also experienced a brief hacking incident upon launching. Miller assured users that the security issue was resolved swiftly, and the platform, described as a non-biased social network, continues to operate. with former Trump adviser Steve Bannon calling it "the Twitter killer"
